definition: ἐγγυάω, impf. ἠγγύων ( παρ-) S. OC 94, E. Supp. 700, X. An. 4.1.17, etc.: aor. ἠγγύησα E. IA 703, D. 29.47, etc.: pf. ἠγγύηκα D.C. 38.9: plpf. ἠγγύηκει Is. 3.58:— Med., fut. - ήσομαι D. 24.46: aor. ἠγγυησάμην And. 1.44, 73, D. 22.53:— Pass., aor. ἠγγυήθην ( ἐξ-, κατ-) Lys. 23.11, D. 59.49: pf. ἠγγύημαι ( δι-) Th. 3.70:—also treated as a compd., ἐνεγυησάμεθα PEleph. 27.9 (iii B. C.), and freq. in codd.: impf. ἐνεγύων Is. 3.45, D. 41.16; ἐνεγύησα Is. 3.36, 70: pf. ἐγγεγύηκα ib. 40, D. 59.53: impf. Pass. ἐνεγυᾶτο Is. 3.70: pf. ἐγγεγύημαι D. 33.24, POxy. 259.7 (i A.D.): plpf. ἐνεγεγύητο Is. 3.55: but these forms are incorrect: ( ἐγγύη):—

children.definition: give or hand over as a pledge:— Med., have a thing pledged to one, accept as a surety, δειλαί τοι δειλῶν γε καὶ ἐγγύαι ἐγγυάασθαι Od. 8.351 (nowhere else in Hom.).

data.quote: δειλαί τοι δειλῶν γε καὶ ἐγγύαι ἐγγυάασθαι

children.definition: plight, betroth, θυγατέρα ἐγγυᾶν τινι Hdt. 6.57 (v. infr.); Ζεὺς ἠγγύησε καὶ δίδωςʼ E. IA 703:— Med., have a woman plighted or betrothed to one, c. acc., D. 57.41:— Act. and Med. opposed, Hdt. 6.130:— Pass., of the man, to be betrothed, θυγατρί τινος Pl. Lg. 923d.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., pledge oneself, give security, ἐγγύας ἐγγυησάμενοι πρὸς τὸ δημόσιον And. 1.73, cf. Pl. Lg. 953e; ἐπί τισι Lys. 23.9; ἐ. τινὶ ὅτι . . Pl. Euthd. 274b.
inf. fut., promise or engage that . . , Pi. O. 11(10).16, Ar. Pl. 1202, X. An. 7.4.13, Pl. Prt. 336d, etc.; ἐγγυᾶσθαί [τινα] καὶ ὁμολογεῖν παρέξειν Lys. 13.23; ἐγγυωμένη δώσειν Babr. 58.10.

answer for, ἐγγυᾶσθαι τὰ μέλλοντʼ ἔσεσθαι D. 18.191: c.acc. pers., Pl. Lg. 855b; ἐγγυᾶσθαί τινά τινι give surety for him to another, D. 33.28; ἐγγύην ἐγγυᾶσθαί τινα πρός τινα Pl. Phd. 115d; ἐ. τὰ μετέωρα give guarantees without security, SIG 364.46 ( Ephesus, iii B.C.).
Dion.Byz. 1:—written ἐγγύ-βαθος in Suid.
GDI 1804.3 (Delph.).

definition: ἐγγύη (rarely ἐγγύα; but τὴν ἐγγύαν IG ΙΙ(2).226 A 29 ( Delph., iii B.C.), cf. Epich. (v. infr.), PSI 4.346 (iii B.C.)), ἡ: ( ἐν, γύαλον, cf. ἐγγυαλίζω):—

children.definition: pledge put into oneʼs hand: generally, surety, security, whether received or given, Od. 8.351; ἐ. τιθέναι τινί A. Eu. 898; ἐγγύας ἀποτίνειν ὑπέρ τινος Antipho 2.2.12; ἐ. ἐγγυᾶσθαι (v. ἐγγυάω II); ἀποδιδόναι D. 53.27; ἐ. ὁμολογεῖν, = Lat. vadimonium facere, D.H. 11.32, OGI 455.3 (Epist. M. Antonii); τῆς ἐ. τῆς ἐπὶ τὴν τράπεζαν D. 33.10; ἐγγύας ἄτα ʼστι θυγάτηρ, ἐγγύα δὲ ζαμίας Epich. 268: prov., ἐγγύη, πάρα δʼ ἄτη Pl. Chrm. 165a, etc.

data.quote: τῆς ἐ. τῆς ἐπὶ τὴν τράπεζαν
ἐγγύας ἄτα ʼστι θυγάτηρ, ἐγγύα δὲ ζαμίας

children.definition: betrothal, Pl. Lg. 774e; ἐ. ποιεῖσθαί τινος Is. 3.28.
ἐ.· σημεῖον ἐν θυτικῇ, Hsch. [ ῠ; ῡ only in AP 9.366.]
security, PMasp. 169.14 (vi A.D.).
security, CIG 2953 b38 (Delos(?)), BGU 981.36 (i A.D.), v.l. in D. 24.73; right of giving security, IG 2(2).10.

children.label: II
children.definition: betrothal, Is. 3.53; κατʼ ἐγγύησιν Alciphr. 3.1.

one who gives security, surety, guarantor, ἐγγυητὴν καθιστάναι Hdt. 1.196, Antipho 5.17, Lys. 23.12, IG 2(2).1172.22, etc.; ἄξιος ἐ. τινος Thphr. Char. 18.6; παρέχειν Pl. Lg. 871e; λαμβάνειν τινὰ ἐ. D. 33.7; διδόναι Plb. 12.16.3, etc.; ἐπʼ ἐγγυητῶν ἐκμισθοῦν under securities, X. Vect. 3.14; ἐ. τοῦ ἀργυρίου ἀξιόχρεως for the money, Pl. Ap. 38c; οἱ ἐ. τῆς τραπέζης those who had given security for the bank (and were liable in case of its failure), D. 33.10; ὁ νόμος ἐ. ἀλλήλοις τῶν δικαίων Arist. Pol. 1280b11; τὸ νόμισμα οἷον ἐ. ὑπὲρ τῆς ἀλλαγῆς Id. EN 1133b12; εἰ μή τις θεῶν ἐστιν ἐ., ὡς . . D.H. 11.41.

data.quote: ὁ νόμος ἐ. ἀλλήλοις τῶν δικαίων
τὸ νόμισμα οἷον ἐ. ὑπὲρ τῆς ἀλλαγῆς
εἰ μή τις θεῶν ἐστιν ἐ., ὡς . .

children.definition: connected with suretyship, πράγματα, πρόσωπα, Heph.Astr. 2.28, 30.

definition: ἐγγυητός, ή, όν, always of a wife,

children.definition: plighted, wedded, ἐγγυητὴ γυνή, opp. to an ἑταίρα, Is. 3.77, D. 59.60.

definition: ἐγγυήτρια, ἡ, fem. of ἐγγυητής, Stud.Pal. 20.139 (vi A.D.).

children.definition: from nigh at hand, ἐ. ἐλθεῖν to approach, Il. 5.72; ἐ. σκοπεῖν S. Ph. 467, cf. Th. 3.13, Pl. Plt. 289d, etc.
hard by, ἐ. ἱσταμένη Il. 10.508; ἐ. εἰσίν Od. 6.279.
ἐ. τινί hard by him, Il. 17.554, etc.; ἐπεὶ φόνος ἐ. αὐτῷ 18.133, cf. 19.409: c. gen., ἐ. Ἀρήνης 11.723; θνῄσκοντος ἐ. παρών A. Ch. 852.
stand for vessels, tripods, etc., Lys. Fr. 34, Hegesand. 45; cf. ἐγγυοθήκη.
hard by, near, in Ep. mostly c. gen., Il. 6.317, Hes. Op. 343; αὐτοῖν Theoc. 21.8: less freq. c. dat., Il. 22.300: abs., 7.341, Hes. Op. 288.

children.label: II
children.definition: nigh at hand, ἐγγύθι δʼ ἠώς Il. 10.251.
stretch the limbs upon, v.l. for συνέκαμψεν, LXX 4 Ki. 4.35; cf. ἐγγυιώσεται· συμπλακήσεται, ἐναγκαλισθήσεται, Hsch.

exercise in, τὴν ψυχὴν θεάμασιν ἐ. Luc. Salt. 6; τὴν γνώμην ἐνθυμήμασιν Polyaen. 3 Praef.:—more freq. in Med., ἐν σοὶ ἐγγυμνασόμενος to practise upon you, Pl. Phdr. 228e; practise oneself in . . , πολέμοις Plu. Caes. 28, cf. Ph. 1.551, Luc. Lex. 22, Jul. Or. 1.37c; ἐν ταῖς πράξεσιν D.C. 36.32, cf. BKT 3p.25:— Pass., Hp. Vict. 2.63; ἐγγυμνασθέντες περί τι Vett.Val. 353.5; λόγοις Luc. Hipp. 2.
one must practise oneself in, Them. Or. 4.51b.
Luc. Lex. 2.
secured, under good security, μνᾶς . . ἐγγύους ἐπὶ τόκῳ δεδανεισμένας Lys. 32.15 (but v. ἔγγαιος II).
reliable, in Comp., ὅπλα -ώτερα Them. Or. 15.197c (nisi leg. ἐχεγγ-).

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., = ἐγγυητής, ἔγγυον παρέχειν Thgn. 286, cf. X. Vect. 4.20, Arist. Oec. 1350a19, SIG 364.41 ( Ephesus), 976.13 ( Samos), PEleph. 8.19, Ep.Hebr. 7.22, etc.; ἔ. τῆς προξενίας giving security for . . , IG 9(2).4 ( Hypata), etc.: fem. in Aeschin. Ep. 11.12, BGU 1051.10 ( i B.C./ i A.D.).

definition: ἐγγύς [ῠ], Adv., Comp. ἐγγυτέρω ( -τέρῳ Hell.Oxy. 6.3), also - ύτερον Pl. Lg. 704e: Sup. ἐγγυτάτω or - ύτατα (first in Hp., and Att.); also ἔγγῑον, ἔγγιστα (v. ἐγγίων).

children.label: I
children.definition: near, nigh, at hand: freq. in Hom., ἐ. γὰρ νυκτός τε καὶ ἤματός εἰσι κέλευθοι Od. 10.86: c. gen., hard by, near to; so λύπας ἐγγυτέρω nearer to grief, S. OC 1217: c. dat., Il. 11.340, E. Heracl. 37; ἐγγὺς ὁδῷ dub. in IG 1(2).974: mostly with Verbs of rest, ἐ. ἑστάναι, παρεστάναι, A. Pers. 686, Eu. 65; but ἐ. χωρεῖν Id. Th. 59: c. gen., οἱ ἐγγυτάτω τῆς ἀγορᾶς κατεσκευασμένοι Lys. 24.20, etc.

data.quote: ἐ. γὰρ νυκτός τε καὶ ἤματός εἰσι κέλευθοι

children.label: II
children.definition: nigh at hand, Il. 22.453; ἐ. ἡμῖν ὁ ἀγών X. Cyr. 2.3.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: nearly, ἔτεσι ἐ. εἴκοσι Th. 6.5; μισθὸς ἐ. ἐνιαυτοῦ X. HG 3.1.28: generally, nearly, almost, ἐ. ἔγνως S. Ichn. 301; οὐδʼ ἐ. τινος not nearly, i. e. not by a great deal, nothing like it, Pl. Smp. 198b; ἔχει οὐχ οὕτω ταῦτα οὐδʼ ἐ. not so . . nor yet nearly so, D. 21.30; οὐκ ἐποίουν τοῦτο, οὐδʼ ἐ. Id. 18.96; mostly, Hp. Mochl. 34.

children.label: IV
children.definition: coming near, ἐ. τι καὶ παραπλήσιον Pl. Grg. 520a; ἐγγύτατα τοῦ νῦν τρόπου, τῆς ξυμπάσης γνώμης, Th. 1.13, 22; ὅτι ἐγγύτατα τούτων Id. 7.86; κοινῇ δὲ πᾶσιν οὐδεὶς ἐγγυτέρω D. 18.288; δοκεῖς δηλῶσαι ἐγγύτατα τὴν ῥητορικήν Pl. Grg. 452e; ἐ. εἶναι, c. gen., Id. Phd. 116b; ἐ. τυφλῶν Id. R. 508c; ἐ. τι τείνειν τοῦ τεθνάναι very near death, Id. Phd. 65a; κακῶς παθεῖν ἐγγύτατα D. 21.123.

children.label: V
children.definition: akin to, οἱ Ζηνὸς ἐ. A. Fr. 162; ἐγγυτέρω γένει or γένους, Pl. Ap. 30a, Is. 3.72; ἐγγύτατα γένους A. Supp. 388, Lys. Fr. 41, Pl. Hp.Ma. 304d; ἐγγυτάτω γένους IG 1(2).77, Ar. Av. 1666.

definition: ἐγγύτερος [ ῠ], α, ον, Comp. Adj., ( ἐγγύς)

children.definition: nearer, Procop.Gaz. Ep. 62: Sup. ἐγγύτατος, η, ον, nearest, Aen.Tact. 28.3 (s. v.l.), LXX Jb. 6.15; διʼ ἐγγυτάτου, = ἐγγυτάτω, Th. 8.96.
nearness, Str. 8.6.19, A.D. Pron. 24.4, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.35, Them. Or. 14.182b, etc.
forming an angle, esp. right angle, σχῆμα Hp. Art. 22; λίθοι ἐντομῇ ἐγγώνιοι cut square, Th. 1.93; πύργοι J. BJ 7.8.3. Adv. - ίως Paul.Aeg. 6.115.

children.label: II
children.definition: cut into angles, of ivyleaves, Thphr. HP 3.15.4 ( Comp.).

definition: ἐγγωνοειδής, ές, = foreg. II, Thphr. HP 3.12.5.

children.definition: angular piece of land, Tab.Heracl. 2.107.

definition: ἐγδ-, freq. for ἐκδ- in Inscrr. and Papyri:—also ἑγδάκτυλος,
ἐγείλασαν συνήλωσαν, Hsch. (Perh. ἐϝ-, cf. γάλλοι.)

ἐγείρω, Aeol. inf. ἐγέρρην Alc. Supp. 16.12, cf. Et.Gud. 157.48: Ep. impf. ἔγειρον Il. 15.594: fut. ἐγερῶ Pl. Epigr. 21.2 Diehl (cf. ἐξ-, ἐπ-): aor. ἤγειρα, Ep. ἔγ- Od. 15.44: pf. ἐγήγερκα Philostr. Ep. 16: plpf. - κειν J. AJ 17.7.4, D.C. 42.48:— Pass., Pl. R. 330e, etc.: fut. ἐγερθήσομαι Babr. 49.3 (also fut. Med. ἐγεροῦμαι dub. in Polyaen. 1.30.5): aor. ἠγέρθην Hdt. 4.9, etc.; Ep. 3 pl. ἔγερθεν v.l. for ἄγ. in Il. 23.287: pf. ἐγήγερμαι v.l. in Th. 7.51: plpf. ἐγήγερτο Luc. Alex. 19: also, in pass. sense, poet. aor. ἠγρόμην ( ἐξ-) Ar. Ra. 51; 3 sg. ἔγρετο, imper. ἔγρεο, Il. 2.41, Od. 23.5; 2 sg. subj. ἔγρῃ Ar. V. 774; opt. ἔγροιτο Od. 6.113; inf. ἐγρέσθαι (freq. written ἔγρεσθαι, as if from a pres. ἔγρομαι, cf. ἔγρω) ib. 13.124; part. ἐγρόμενος 10.50 (and late Prose, Iamb. Myst. 1.15): intr. pf. ἐγρήγορα (as pres.) Ar. Lys. 306, Pl. Prt. 310b, etc.: plpf. ἠγρηγόρη (as impf.) Ar. Ec. 32; 3 pl. ἐγρηγόρεσαν Id. Pl. 744; 3 sg. ἐγρηγόρει X. Cyr. 1.4.20: Ep. pf. 3 pl. ἐγρηγόρθασι Il. 10.419; imper. ἐγρήγορθε (v.infr. II); inf. ἐγρήγορθαι ib. 67.

children.label: I
children.definition: Act., awaken, rouse, ἐ. τινὰ ἐξ ὕπνου 5.413, etc.; τοὺς δʼ . . ὑπνώοντας ἐγείρει 24.344; ἐ. τινὰ εὐνῆς E. HF 1050 (lyr.); simply, ἐ. τινά A. Eu. 140, etc.: metaph., τὰς τέχνας Theoc. 21.1.

rouse, stir up, Il. 5.208; ἐπεί μιν ἔγειρε Διὸς νόος 15.242; ἐγείρειν Ἄρηα stir the fight, 2.440, etc.; ἐ. μάχην, φύλοπιν, etc., 13.778, 5.496, etc.; Τρωσὶν θυμὸν ἐ. (v.l. ἀγεῖραι) ib. 510; ἐ. τινὰ ἐπὶ ἔργον Hes. Op. 20; ἔγειρε νῆα h.Ap. 408; ἐκδοχὴν πομποῦ πυρὸς ἐ. wake up the bale-fire, A. Ag. 299; λαμπάδας ἐ. Ar. Ra. 340: freq. metaph., ἐ. ἀοιδάν, λύραν, μέλος, θρῆνον, Pi. P. 9.104, N. 10.21, Cratin. 222, S. OC 1778 (anap.); μῦθον Pl. Plt. 272d; τὸ οὖς ἐ. ‘prick up’ the ears, Plot. 5.1.12.
raise from the dead, νεκρούς Ev.Matt. 10.8, cf. 1 Ep.Cor. 15.42 ( Pass.); or from a sick-bed, Ep.Jac. 5.15.
raise, erect a building, Hyp. Fr. 103, Call. Ap. 64, OGI 677.3 (ii A. D.); ναόν Ev.Jo. 2.19, cf. Luc. Alex. 10:— Pass., στῦλος ἐγηγερμένος Bito 66.5, cf. Plu. Alex. 19, Jul. Caes. 320c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., with pf. Act. ἐγρήγορα, wake, ἐγειρομένων ἀνθρώπων Od. 20.100, cf. Hdt. 4.9, etc.; ἔγρετο δʼ ἐξ ὕπνου Il. 2.41: metaph., ἐγειρόμενος εἰς ἐμαυτὸν ἐκ τοῦ σώματος Plot. 4.8.1: in pf., to be awake, ἐγρηγόρθασι Il. 10.419; ἐγρήγορθε stay awake! 7.371, 18.299 (whereas ἔγρεο is wake up! Od. 15.46); ἐγρήγορας ἢ καθεύδεις; Pl. Prt. 310b; πόλις ζῶσα καὶ ἐγρηγορυῖα Id. Lg. 809d; καὶ ἐφρόνει καὶ ἐγρηγόρει X. Cyr. 1.4.20, etc.; of things, ἐγειρομένου χειμῶνος arising, Hdt. 7.49: so metaph., τὰ ἐκ τοῦ βαρβάρου ἐγειρόμενα ib. 148; ἐγρηγορὸς φρούρημα A. Eu. 706; ἐ. τὸ πῆμα Id. Ag. 346, etc.

data.quote: ἐγειρόμενος εἰς ἐμαυτὸν ἐκ τοῦ σώματος

children.definition: rouse or stir oneself, be excited by passion, etc., Hes. Sc. 176, D. 19.305: c. inf., ἐγηγερμένοι ἦσαν μὴ ἀνιέναι τὰ τῶν Ἀθηναίων they were encouraged to prevent the departure of the Athenians, v.l. in Th. 7.51.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., arouse oneself, Aesop. 16b.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἀμφὶ πυρὴν . . ἔγρετο λαός Il. 7.434, 24.789, ἔγρ. is for ἤγρ- ( ἀγείρω); so in Maiist. 52.

definition: ἐγέλα χαλινοί, Hsch. ἐγέλωτοι· ἀστέρες, Id. ἔγεντο, v. γίγνομαι. ἐγεργεῖ· γρηγορεῖ, Id.

children.definition: raising the cry, loud-voiced, IG 3.82.
awakening men, Procl. H. 7.18.
laughter-stirring, AP 11.60 ( Paul.Sil.); Ἀφροδίτη Orph. Fr. 183.
exciting the theatre, APl. 16.361.
battle-stirring, AP 7.424 ( Antip. Sid.):—fem. ἐγερσῐμά-χη, ib. 6.122 (Nicias).
arouse strife, Tz. H. 12.654.
from which one wakes, ὕπνος, opp. the sleep of death, Theoc. 24.7.
soul-stirring, μέθη Nonn. D. 12.376; φωνή ib. 37.673; βίβλοι Procl. H. 3.4.
awaking, Hp. Coac. 82; personified in Emp. 123.1: pl., Phld. Rh. 2.206S., Polyaen. 2.2.6: metaph., ἡ τοῦ θυμοῦ ἔ. Pl. Ti. 70c, Arist. EN 1116b30.

children.label: b
children.definition: awaking from death, Ev.Matt. 27.53; recovery, ἐκ τοῦ πάθεος Aret. SA 2.11.
raising, erection, τειχίων Hdn. 8.5.4 (pl.), cf. Men.Eph. ap. J. AJ 8.5.3.
light-stirring, ἐ. πέτρος the flint, AP 6.5 ( Phil.).
leading the dance, Opp. C. 4.236.
one must raise, E. Rh. 690.
excitement, Ael. VH 2.44: pl., - τήρια δρόμου, of the ears of a hare, Id. NA 13.14.
eagerly, busily, κινεῖν τινα S. Ant. 413; wakefully, Heraclit. 63, E. Rh. 524.
waking, stirring, νοήσεως Pl. R. 523e, 524d.

children.label: II
children.definition: enclitic, because changing the grave accent of the preceding word into the acute, ἐ. ἐπίρρημα AB 1147.
Arist. Somn.Vig. 454b14.
ἐγήγαρτος· ἐπίχαρτος, ἐπιχαρής, Hsch. (leg. ἔγχαρτος). ἐγήρα, v. γηράσκω.

definition: ἐγκαθαιρέω, aor. inf. ἐγκαθελεῖν· καταβαλεῖν, Hsch.

children.definition: fit in, Ar. Lys. 682.
assessor, Gloss.
sit or settle oneself in, Ar. Ec. 23; εἰς θᾶκον Id. Ra. 1523; εἰς ἐνέδραν Arr. Tact. 15.5; encamp in a place, Th. 3.1, 4.2; τῶν δαιμονίων -καθεζομένων J. AJ 6.11.2.
shut up, enclose, J. AJ 5.1.2; φορβείᾳ τὸ ῥαγδαῖον Plu. Cohib. 2.456c:— Pass., Frig. ib. 951b, Jul. Or. 7.206b:—also ἐγκατείργω, Agath. 1.11, al.:— Pass., Aret. SA 1.5, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.44.
shut in, enclosed, Aesop. 40.
put in secretly, suborned, προέδρους ἐ. ὑφέντες Pl. Ax. 368e, cf. D. Ep. 3.34, Plb. 13.5.1, Ev.Luc. 20.20, J. BJ 6.5.2. Adv. - τως, δημηγορεῖν D.S. 16.68.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hyp. Fr. 56.
sleep among, Arist. HA 610b31; sleep upon, ποδήρη ὦτα ὡς ἐγκαθεύδειν Str. 15.1.57; στιβάδα ἐγκαθεύδειν τινὶ παρασκευάσαι Ael. NA 6.42.
lie abed, Ar. Lys. 614.
sleep in a temple to effect a cure, IG 4.951.25 (Epid.), 7.235 (Orop.), etc.
boil in anything, Hp. Mul. 2.133.
pass oneʼs youth in, E. Hipp. 1096.
fix in, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.4.25 ( Pass.).
that which settles in a place, of foreign bodies in the eye, Orib. Eup. 4.31.

sit in or on, X. Eq. 1.11; lie in ambush, ἐν τοῖς τρίβωσιν Ar. Ach. 343, cf. Th. 600; ἐ. καὶ ἐνεδρεύειν Aeschin. 3. 206; of garrisons, lie in a place, Plb. 18.11.6, J. BJ 5.1.2; lie couched in, as the men in the Trojan horse, Pl. Tht. 184d: metaph., ἐ. μεταξύ . . Id. Prm. 156d; ἐγκαθημένον ταῖς ψυχαῖς τοῦ φόβου Plb. 2.23.7; ἐμπόδιον ἐγκαθήμενον Plot. 6.9.7; take oneʼs stand upon, τῷ ῥητῷ Mich. in EN 68.31.
erect or set up in, ἄγαλμα ἐ. χθονί E. IT 978, cf. Ath. 11.473b, J. BJ 2.13.7:— Pass., Philox. 3.5 codd. Ath., Arist. Mu. 397b27, Hld. 5.13.

seat in or upon, εἰς θρόνον Pl. R. 553c; ἐ. στρατιὰν ἐν τοῖς τόποις station a force in a place, Plb. 16.37.4: aor. 1 Med., ναὸν ἐγκαθείσατο (vulg. ἐγκαθείσατο, cf. ἐγκαθισάμενοι τὰ ὅπλα v.l. in J. BJ 5.1.2) founded a temple there, E. Hipp. 31.
administer a sitz-bath to one, Sor. 1.64, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 6.20.18, etc.:— Pass., Hp. Mul. 1.35; also, to be used for such, Dsc. 5.13,30.
cause to subside upon, τοῖς κοιλώμασι τὴν ὑπερκειμένην γῆν Lyd. Ost. 53.

children.label: II
children.definition: sit in or upon, [ θρόνῳ] Pi. P. 4.153:— Med., ἐγκατίζεσθαι εἰς θρόνον take oneʼs seat on . . , Hdt. 5.26.
let down, ἐς τὴν χύτραν Ar. Lys. 308.
send in as agents, Plu. Pyrrh. 11:— Pass., of a catheter, to be passed, Ruf. Ren.Ves. 7.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: commit, entrust, Ζεὺς ἐγκαθίει (for - ίησι) Λοξίᾳ θεσπίσματα A. Fr. 86.
sitz-bath, Dsc. 3.113, Gp. 12.23.5, Sor. 1.56, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: dwelling on a syllable in pronunciation, D.H. Comp. 20, 22 fin.

definition: ἐγκαθισμός, ὁ, = foreg. [ἐγκάθισμα] II, D.H. Dem. 43 (pl.).

children.definition: one must administer a sitz-bath, Sor. 2.11, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.109.

place or establish in, as king or chief, σὲ . . Μυκήναις ἐγκαταστήσω πάλιν E. IT 982; ἐ. τινὰς ἡγεμόνας Th. 1.4; τινὰ τύραννον D. 17.10; also, place as a garrison in a place, v.l. in Id. 9.15; φρουράν Plu. Alc. 30; of institutions, ἐ. δημοκρατίας Arr. An. 1.18.2:— Med., establish for oneself, βασιλείην Hellanic. 79 (a) J.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., with aor. 2, pf. and plpf. Act., to be established as ruler in a place, Lys. 2.59, Th. 1.122; also αὐλητῶν νόμῳ ἐγκαθεστώτων Id. 5.70.
look closely into, τινὸς τῷ προσώπῳ Plu. Demetr. 38; εἰς τὸ ὕδωρ IG 4.951.66 (Epid.): abs., Pl. Epin. 990e.

children.label: II
children.definition: remark something in a person or thing, Plu. Brut. 16.
run into harbour, come to anchor, αὐτόσε Th. 4.1, cf. D.C. 48.49: aor. Pass., Arr. An. 2.20.8.
putting into harbour, Arr. An. 1.18.5.
riot or revel in, τρυφαῖς E. Tr. 997.

definition: ἐγκαθυφαίνω, v.l. for καθ-, LXX Ex. 28.17.

children.definition: feast of renovation or consecration, Thd. Da. 3.2, LXX 2 Es. 6.16; esp. that established by Judas Maccabaeus at the reconsecration of the Temple, Ev.Jo. 10.22.

restore, τεῖχος LXX Is. 16.11; βασιλείαν 1 Ki. 11.14; make afresh ὁδόν Ep.Hebr. 10.20; consecrate, inaugurate, οἶκον Κυρίου LXX 3 Ki. 8.63:— Pass., Ep.Hebr. 9.18, IG 12(5).712.58 ( Syros); χύτρα -ισμένα Archig. ap. Orib. 8.46.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: innovate, prob. in PPar. 16.24 (ii B.C.).

definition: ἐγκαινίς, ίδος, ἡ, dub. sens. in Agath. 5.21. (Perh. ἐγκενίς,

children.definition: consecration, LXX Nu. 7.88 ( v.l. - ωσις).

definition: ἐγκαινισμός, ὁ, = foreg. [ἐγκαίνισις], LXX 1 Ma. 4.56 ( v.l. - ιασμός), Nu. 7.10, al.

children.definition: seasonableness, opp. ἀκαιρία, Pl. Plt. 305d; τροφῆς Aret. CA 1.1.
Pl. Ti. 51d ( Sup.), PGrenf. 1.64.
timely, seasonable, Pl. Plt. 282e, Lg. 928a, Them. Or. 26.331a: Sup., Pl. Lg. 717a. Adv. - ρως Aristaenet. 1.15: Sup. - ότατα Them. Or. 9.120c.

definition: ἐγκαίω, aor. 1 part. ἐγκέας IG 1(2).374.96, but -καύσας SIG 2587.186:—

children.definition: burn or heat in, ὀβελοὶ ἐγκεκαυμένοι πυρί E. Cyc. 393.
brand, Luc. Pisc. 46:— Pass., βοῦς ἐγκεκαυμένας ῥόπαλον Arr. An. 5.3.4.
scorch, of the sun, Gp. 18.17.1.
paint in encaustic, i.e. with colours mixed with wax, IG l.c., 11(2).199 A 80 ( Delos, iii B. C.), LXX 2 Ma. 2.29, Plin. 35.122.
Pass., to be over-heated, Gal. 2.870, Aret. CD 1.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: make a fire in, πῦρ Plu. Alex. 24; οἶκοι ἐγκαιόμενοι heated chambers, Luc. VH 2.11.

children.label: IV
children.definition: offer sacrifice, Ἀπόλλωνι Paus. 1.42.6.

behave remissly in a thing, ἐνεκάκησαν τὸ πέμπειν they culpably omitted to send, Plb. 4.19.10, cf. Thd. Pr. 3.11, Sm. Ge. 27.46: c. part., τὸ καλὸν ποιοῦντες μὴ ἐγκακῶμεν Ep.Gal. 6.9: abs., Ev.Luc. 18.1, al., cf. BGU 1043.3 (iii A. D.); cf. ἐκκακέω.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐγκακοῦμεν· ὑψοῦμεν, Hsch.
call in a debt, Isoc. 17.44, X. An. 7.7.33, D. 31.6, 36.14: generally, demand as oneʼs due, ἀργύριον Lys. 3.26.
invoke, τὴν τῶν θεῶν ἰατρείαν Str. 14.1.44.

children.label: II
children.definition: bring a charge or accusation against a person:—Constr.: c. dat. pers. et acc. rei, charge something against one, φόνους ἐ. τινί S. El. 778, cf. Pl. Ap. 26c, etc.; ἐ. ἔγκλημά τινι Hyp. Lyc. 18, cf. Eux. 24; χόλον κατʼ αὐτῶν ἐ. S. Ph. 328: folld. by a relat. clause, ἐ. τινὶ ὅτι . . X. An. 7.5.7: c. inf., ἐστὶν ἃ ἐνεκάλει τοῖς Ἀθηναίοις παραβαίνειν τὰς σπονδάς Th. 4.123: c. part., ἐ. αὐτοῖς ἀμελοῦσιν Pl. Prt. 346a: freq. c. dat. pers. only, accuse, Antipho 4.2.2, etc.; ἐ. περί τινων Inscr.Prien. 28.8 (ii B. C.); ἐπὶ τοῖς διῳκημένοις ib. 37.128 (ii B. C.): c. acc. rei only, bring as a charge, εἴ τι ἄλλο ἐνεκάλουν Th. 5.46, cf. 6.53; τὸ νεῖκος ἐγκαλεῖν throw the blame of quarrel on another, S. OT 702: abs., οἱ ἐγκαλέσαντες Arist. Rh.Al. 1437a17: rarely c. gen.rei, τῆς βραδύτητος αὐτοῖς ἐνεκάλει Plu. Arist. 10:— Pass., ἐγκαλεῖται τῇ τύχῃ a charge is brought against . . , Arist. EN 1120b17; ἐνίων ἐγκληθέντων ἐπὶ τῷ βίῳ Phld. Piet. p.93 G.; τὰ ἐγκεκλημένα charges, OGI 90.14 (ii B. C.): also with person. constr., ἐγκαλεῖσθαι ὑπέρ τινος D.H. 7.46; τινός D.C. 58.4:— Locr. part. ἐγκαλείμενος may be either Med. or Pass., IG 9(1).334.41.

data.quote: ἐστὶν ἃ ἐνεκάλει τοῖς Ἀθηναίοις παραβαίνειν τὰς σπονδάς

children.definition: prosecute, take proceedings against, οὔτʼ ἐγκαλοῦντες οὔτʼ ἐγκαλούμενοι D. 34.1; ἐ. δίκην τινί Id. 40.19; ἐ. τινὶ περί τινος Isoc. 4.40: abs., Ar. Av. 1455.
object, c. acc. et inf., Phld. Sign. 29.
roll about in, τῇσι ψάμμοισι Aret. CD 1.2: metaph., πολλῇσι συμφορῇσι Hp. Ep. 17; ταραχαῖς καὶ κινδύνοις Agath. 4.27; wallow in, ταῖς λιχνείαις Ath. 6.262b, cf. Them. Or. 29.346b.
take pride in, τοῖς αἰσχροῖς Plu. Ant. 36; βωμολοχίαις Agath. 1.13, cf. Arr. Epict. 3.22.59, Ael. VH 9.35; boast of, ταῖς φίλαις τῇ ἀξιώσει J. AJ 18.3.4: abs., Ph. 2.28.
ornament, decoration, Th. 2.62, Plot. 3.5.9, Them. Or. 6.83c; of a person, γένους Agath. Praef. p.135 D.
having his legs in the stocks, Com. Adesp. 988.
covering, wrapping up, cj. in Ar. Av. 1496.
fit to be veiled, hidden, Ap. Ty. Ep. 18.
veiling-feast, opp. ἀνακαλυπτήρια, Philostr. VS 2.25.4.

veil, wrap up, Ar. Ra. 911:— Pass., to be veiled or enwrapped, Id. Pl. 714, Pl. Phdr. 243b; to be wrapped up (as for sleep), X. An. 4.5.19, Pl. Prt. 315d; ἐγκεκαλυμμένος λόγος, a noted fallacy, Stoic. 2.8,90, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., hide oneself, hide oneʼs face, Ar. Pl. 707, etc.; ἐγκαλυπτόμενος καθεύδειν And. 1.17; of persons at the point of death, X. Cyr. 8.7.26, Pl. Phd. 118a, etc.: metaph., conceal oneʼs feelings, c. part., νεμεσῶν ἐνεκαλύπτετο App. BC 2.69.
Pl. Phd. 117c, D. Ep. 3.42, Aeschin. 2.107: c.acc. pers., feel shame before a person, θεοὺς ἐγκαλυπτόμενος ὧν ἔμελλε δράσειν App. BC 1.16: c. inf., to be ashamed to . . , PMasp. 295.12 (v A.D.).
καλυπτόμενος σφυγμός, term invented by Archig., Gal. 8.662.
concealment, Str. 10.2.12 (pl.); τῆς ψυχῆς ὑπὸ τοῦ σώματος Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.266e; ἐν ἐγκαλύψει εἶναι to be wrapped in obscurity, M.Ant. 5.10.
grow weary or slack in or at a thing, τινί J. AJ 2.15.5; become slack, ταῖς εὐτυχίαις Id. BJ 3.10.2; ἐς ἔργον Aret. SD 1.15.
bend in, bend, X. Eq. 1.8, Gal. 18(2).353.
pour in wine, ἐγκάναξον E. Cyc. 152, Ar. Eq. 105; κύλικα Alciphr. 3.36.
make a sound on a thing, ἐ. κόχλῳ blow on a conch, Theoc. 9.27.
in or of the inner angle of the eye, Dsc. Eup. 1.8, Gal. 19.437.
tumour in the inner angle of the eye, Cels. 7.7.5, Gal. UP 10.11, etc.

definition: ἐγκαπῆ ἐπικαρπία, Hsch. ἐγκάπνισμα, ατος, τό,

children.definition: fumigation, Gloss.
gulp down greedily, snap up, Ar. Pax 7, V. 791, Stratt. 25, Hermipp. 26, Alex. 128.7; ἐ. αἰθέρα γνάθοις hold oneʼs breath, E. Cyc. 629.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐγκάπτει· ἐκπνεῖ, Hsch.
= sq., φῶς Iamb. Myst. 2.7.

in the heart, ἐγκάρδιόν ἐστί (or γίγνεταί) τί τινι it goes to his heart, Democr. 262, D.S. 1.45; τἀγκ. τις ἐρεῖ what is in his heart, Phld. Lib. p.14 O. Adv., ὅταν γεννηθῇς ἐγκαρδίως PMag.Par. 1.1785.
in close proximity, of planets, Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).105.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐγκάρδιον, τό ( ἐγκάρδιος, ὁ, S.E. M. 9.119), heart-wood, core, Thphr. HP 3.8.5, 5.3.2; pith, Dsc. 1.109.5, Gp. 12.25.3.
core, Roussel Cultes Égyptiens 236 ( Delos, ii B. C.).
the brain, AP 9.519.3 ( Alc.), Lyc. 1104.

definition: ἐγκαρπία, ἡ, perh. f.l. for εὐκαρπία, EM 797.27.

children.definition: containing seed: hence, ripe, Hp. Vict. 2.55.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐγκάρπια, τά, unreaped crops, SIG 633.87 ( Milet., ii B. C.).

containing fruit, κάλυξιν ἐγκάρποις χθονός S. OT 25; fruitful, σπέρματα Pl. Phdr. 276b; of soil, Thphr. CP 2.4.2; γᾶν ἔγκαρπον φέρειν may the earth bear produce, SIG 526.41 ( Crete); δένδρα Plu. Lib.educ. 2.2e; τέλη ἔγκαρπα tithe of produce, S. Tr. 238: metaph., χρήσιμον καὶ ἔ. fruitful, Plu. Max. cum princip. 2.776b, cf. Luc. Merc.Cond. 39 ( Sup.). Adv. - πως, διακεῖσθαι Aen.Tact. 7.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἔγκαρπα, τά, festoons of fruit on friezes or the capitals of columns, Lat. encarpa, Vitr. 4.1.7.
ἔγκαρπα or ἔγκαρτα, = τοὺς κεκουρευμένους πυρούς, Phryn. Trag.4 (ap. Hsch.).
being in seed, Gal. 13.570.

definition: ἐγκάρσιος, α, ον ( ος, ον Gal. UP 5.12 codd.),

children.definition: athwart, oblique, Th. 2.76, 6.99, Ach.Tat. 3.2, Hld. 3.2; of the ecliptic, Arist. Mu. 392a12 ( v.l. - ίως).
persevere or persist in a thing, τινί v.l. in X. Mem. 2.6.22; ἐγκαρτερεῖν [τούτοις] ἃ ἔγνωτε Th. 2.61; πρὸς δίψαν Plu. Bruta anim. 2.987e: c. inf., μὴ φιληθῆναι Id. Ages. 11.
await stedfastly, θάνατον E. HF 1351, Andr. 262.
hold out, remain firm under, c. dat., ταῖς πληγαῖς Plu. Pomp. 79; τοῖς δεινοῖς Luc. Anach. 38: abs., Plu. Lyc. 18, PAmh. 2.78 (ii A. D.).
deep in, prob. in Hp. VC 5, cf. Gal. 19.94.
inwards, entrails, Hom., always in acc., as Od. 9.293, exc. dat. ἔγκασι in Il. 11.438; ἐν ἔγκασιν ᾅδου AP 15.40.42 (Comet.): later, nom. sg. ἔγκατον LXX 3 Ki. 17.22, Luc. Lex. 3.
go down into, put oneself in, c. acc., κροκωτὸν σπάργανον ἐγκατέβα Pi. N. 1.38: c. dat., dub. l. in D.S. 14.28; εἰς . . Gal. UP 2.15: abs., Id. 8.686.
throw down into, μέσῃ δʼ ἐνικάββαλε δίνῃ A.R. 1.1239 (but written divisim, μέσῳ δʼ ἐνὶ κ. ὁμίλῳ Il. 12.206); εἰς . . Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.67 ( Pass.).
pass oneʼs life in, Plu. An seni 2.783d, Longin. 44.11.
wet or soak with, Gp. 13.1.7.
penetrate deeply, Democr. A. 77 D.
grow old in, τῇ ἀρχῇ Arist. Ath. 17.1; ἐν πενίᾳ Plu. Phoc. 30; become inveterate in, Din. 2.3:—also ἐγκατα-γηράω, ταῖς μοναρχίαις Them. Or. 19.232c.
put up at a place, Nic.Dam.p.138 D., Poll. 1.73.
write down among, Ael. Fr. 67; portray, Aen.Gaz. Ep. 12.
overpower:— Pass., ὑπὸ κωνώπων ἐγκαταδαμασθείς dub. in Hp. Epid. 7.79 (sed leg. ἐν καταδήγμασιν).
sleep in, Plu. QConv. 2.647f.

children.label: II
children.definition: go to sleep over a thing, τῷ διψῆν QConv. ib. 688f.
bind fast in, τινί Pl. Phd. 84a, Them. Or. 23.297a ( Pass.), Opp. H. 3.201.

definition: ἐγκαταδύνω [ῡ], aor. - κατέδυν, of the sun,

children.definition: set upon a place, Hp. Aër. 6; sink beneath, ὕδασιν AP 7.532 ( Isid.); μυχόν Opp. H. 1.153: abs., sink, be absorbed in, Archig. ap. Aët. 3.167, Gal. 7.217: metaph., to be immersed in, c. dat., Dam. Pr. 10:— Med., τοῖς οἰκείοις ἐπιτηδεύμασι Procop. Arc. 1.
associate with, adapt to, νέας βουλὰς νέοισιν ἐγκαταζεύξας τρόποις S. Aj. 736.
lie in, c. dat., κλισμῷ Thgn. 1191.
lie in bed, sleep, παρά τινι Ar. Pl. 742.
empty out into, Hippiatr. 74.
enclosing, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 49.553.
shut up in a place, E. Fr. 1132.39.
shut up in, enclose, τινὰ τῷ νεῷ Alex. 40.3, cf. Arist. Pr. 937a29; τὸ θερμὸν Thphr. CP 5.13.2:— Pass., Hp. Acut. 16, Arist. Mete. 378a29.
put to bed in a place, Ar. Pl. 621:— Pass., lie down in, σισύραν ἐγκατακλῐνῆναι μαλθακήν Id. Av. 122; ἐγκατακλιθῆναι εἰς τὸ ἱερόν Hyp. Eux. 14.
interweave, Hsch.
compounded of ἔγκατα and κνάκων, Philox. 3.11.
tread a measure among them, Ar. Ra. 330.
hide in, τί τινι Lyc. 1231, cf. Gal. 2.305, al.; ὄνομα βυθοῖς in religious mysteries, IG 3.900.
catch in a place, hem in, Th. 4.116; ἐ. τινὰ ὅρκοις trammel by oaths, ib. 19; ἐὰν λογισμὸς ἐγκαταλαμβάνῃ αὐτόν Aeschin. 3.60:— Pass., Th. 3.33, Arist. Pr. 926b31.

children.label: II
children.definition: follow in immediate succession, παννυχὶς ἐ. ἑορτήν Aristid. Or. 47(23).6, cf. 26(14).84; attack immediately after, ἡ ἐπὶ τῷ ἐμέτῳ ἀσιτία [τινὰ] ἐ. Id. 47(23).60.

data.quote: ἡ ἐπὶ τῷ ἐμέτῳ ἀσιτία [τινὰ] ἐ.

children.definition: build in, πολλαὶ στῆλαι ἐγκατελέγησαν were built into the wall, Th. 1.93.
count or reckon among, Luc. Par. 3; τινὰς εἰς τοὺς Εὐπατρίδας, = Lat. adlegere inter patricios, D.C. 43.47; enlist soldiers, AP 11.265 ( Lucill.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., lie in or on, Ep. aor. ἐγκατέλεκτο A.R. 4.431.
remnant, residue, trace, Arist. Fr. 13, cf. LXX Je. 11.23, al.
residual trace, εἰδώλου Epicur. Ep. 1p.12U.
kneading trough, LXX De. 28.5, 17.
sediment: hence, silting-up, PPetr. 2p.14 (iii B.C.).

leave behind, παῖδα Hes. Op. 378; ἐ. φρουρὰν ἐν τῇ νήσῳ Th. 3.51; πλεῖον ἐ. ἐξιόντες ἐκ τῆς ὠνῆς PRev.Laws 53.12; ἐ. τὸ κέντρον, of a bee, Pl. Phd. 91c: hence of Pericles, τὸ κέντρον ἐγκατέλιπε τοῖς ἀκροωμένοις Eup. 94.7; ἐ. τὴν μάχαιραν ἐν τῇ σφαγῇ Antipho 5.69.

data.quote: πλεῖον ἐ. ἐξιόντες ἐκ τῆς ὠνῆς
ἐ. τὴν μάχαιραν ἐν τῇ σφαγῇ

children.definition: leave in the lurch, Pl. Smp. 179a, Lycurg. 2, D. 57.58, Ev.Matt. 27.46, Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 4.22, etc.; abandon, νεκροὺς Th. 4.44; ἀκρόπολιν X. HG 5.4.13.
leave out, omit, Hdt. 3.119.
leave traces behind, Epicur. Nat.Herc. 1420.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be left behind in a race, Hdt. 8.59.
leave residual symptoms or sequelae, Hp. Epid. 6.2.6, 6.7.7.
mix in an ointment, λίπος Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 33 (11).
residual symptom (v. - ληψις).
to be reckoned among, [ πόλεσιν] εὖ πραττούσαις Philostr. VS 2.24.1.
inclusive, Gal. 19.235.
catching or being caught in a place, being hemmed in, Th. 5.72; suppression of urine, Hp. Epid. 6.2.7 (codd.sedleg. ἐγκατάλειψις).
concept ( = κατάληψις), Gal. 14.685, cf. 19.350.
Hp. Aph. 2.12 ( Pass.), Arist. Rh. 1368b19.
reckon in, Is. 11.45.
divide into relays or courses, LXX 2 Ch. 31.18.

mix with, τί τινι Timo 33, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 13, etc.; φάρμακον πότῳ Ach.Tat. 4.15; τινὰς λόχοις D.H. 6.2; ἑαυτοὺς τοῖς στρατιώταις Hdn. 7.12.7: metaph., κέντρον τωθασμοῖς Ph. 2.570; θεὸν ἀνθρωπίναις χρείαις Plu. Def.orac. 2.414f; of a sculptor, μανίην λίθῳ APl. 16.57 ( Paul.Sil.), cf. AP 9.593:— Pass., to be mixed in or with, ἐγκαταμειγνύμενος ὕδατι Hp. Aër. 6; ἐγκαταμεμιγμένα τοῖς λεγομένοις Isoc. 15.10; ὀνόματα -μιγέντα τῇ λέξει D.H. Comp. 25.
in a mixed manner, Sch.rec. S. OT 95.
remain in, Thphr. HP 1.3.4, Hld. 1.33, etc.; continue the use of, τισί Antyll. ap. Aët. 9.42.
intermingling, infusion, Alex.Aphr. in Sens. 74.26, Olymp. in Mete. 157.29.
= -μείγνυμι, τῇ διηγήσει τὰς θεατρικὰς γοητείας D.H. Th. 7:— Pass., Id. Dem. 22, cf. EM 770.52, Et.Gud. 533.49.
Hsch.

definition: ἐγκατάνα κατὰ γνώμην, κατὰ νοῦν, Hsch.

children.definition: make to dwell in, οὐρανῷ τινά A.R. 3.116, Moero 1.
bestow upon, τί τινι Jul. Or. 5.179b.
wash over with a thing, Hippiatr. 26.
washing over, Hp. Decent. 8.
to be backed, μέρεσι ἱππείοις Tz. H. 6.965.
dry, opp. κάθυγρος, γῆ Gp. 2.13 tit.
mock at, τινί LXX Jb. 40.14(19).
thrust firmly in, ξίφος . . κουλεῷ ἐγκατέπηξʼ Od. 11.98; ἐν δὲ σκόλοπας κατέπηξεν planted or fixed them in, Il. 9.350; τὴν κεφαλὴν δόρατι ἐ. having fixed it on, Hdn. 1.13.4.
sheathe, ξίφος Plu. Par.min. 2.313e.
burn in, τινά τινι Phalar. Ep. 122.4.
to be swallowed up, of a ship, Ph. 1.670: metaph. of persons, Id. 2.300, al.; to be absorbed, immersed, Dam. Pr. 67.
fall or throw oneself upon, λέκτροισιν A.R. 3.655; ὅρμῳ AP 9.82 (Antip. Thess.).
interweave, entwine, ἀκάνθας διʼ ἀλλήλων Plu. Am. prol. 2.494a:— Pass., X. Cyn. 9.12.
suffocate in, Gal. 7.673:— Pass., aor. inf. -πνῐγῆναι Diocl. Fr. 55.
swallowing up, Ph. 1.116.
count, number, reckon in or among, τὴν ἔκφρασιν τοῖς γυμνάσμασιν Hermog. Prog. 10, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 46.9:— Pass., to be counted in or among, Arist. SE 167b24.
sew in, Aen. Tact. 31.4:— Pass., X. Cyn. 6.1.
quench in a thing, τὸ λογικὸν ἐγκατέσβεσται τῆς ψυχῆς Plu. Sollert. 2.975c, cf.987d.
grow rotten or corrupt in, Hp. Mul. 1.63, E. ap. Stob. 3.41.
prepare in a place, ἐν ταῖς πόλεσι προδότας D.S. 16.54; but the Prep. ἐν freq. has little force, Id. 2.24 (s.v.l.), 14.91.
elaborate, ornate, of style, opp. ἁπλοῦς, D.H. Comp. 18, al., cf. Phld. Rh. 1.164S., Demetr. Eloc. 15. Adv. - ως S.E. M. 2.56.
fall upon, of lightning, εἴς τινα D.C. 49.15; of epidemics, πολλαχόσε ἐ. Th. 2.47, cf. Gal. 10.880: metaph., Ph. 2.471, Ael. Fr. 348.

children.label: II
children.definition: hurl down among or upon, of lightning, ἐγκατάσκηψον βέλος S. Tr. 1087; κακῶν ἃ Πέρσαις ἐγκατέσκηψεν θεός A. Pers. 514.
sudden attack, Philum. Ven. 4.5.

children.label: I

ἐγκεῖσθαί τινι to be involved in, πόθῳ Archil. 84; βλάβαις S. Ph. 1318; μόχθοις E. Ion 181 (anap.); πολλαῖς ξυμφοραῖς Id. Hel. 269; κακοπαθείαις Plb. 14.9.5 codd.: c. acc., μελεδῶνας ἔγκειμαι I have cares laid on me, A.R. 2.627.

Th. 4.22; πολὺς τοῖς συμβεβηκόσι ἔγκειται he insists much upon . . , D. 18.199; ἄγαν ἐ. τινί to be vehement against one, Ar. Ach. 309; ἰσχυρῶς ἐ. Th. 1.69; βαρὺς ἐγκεῖσθαι D.H. 6.62; ὅλος ἐγκεῖσθαί τινι to be devoted to one, Theoc. 3.33; ἐ. ἐπὶ τὰ πονηρά LXX Ge. 8.21.

decline, become worse, Plu. Sull. 1, etc.
wheel, ἐπὶ δόρυ ἢ ἐπὶ ἀσπίδα Arr. Tact. 21.3.

inclination, ἔ. λαβεῖν, of the earth, D.L. 2.9, cf. Pl. Amat. 132b; of the ecliptic ( ὁ λοξὸς κύκλος), Arist. GC 336b4; of ground, ἔ. ἔχειν πρὸς ἕω Id. Pol. 1330a39; εἰς νότον Porph. Antr. 26; ἐγκλίσεις τῆς κεφαλῆς εἰς τὰ δεξιά Arist. Phgn. 808a13; ἐ. σχημάτων τριγώνων Onos. 10.28 (pl.); ἐ. δορατίου, in signalling, Id. 26.1.

data.quote: ἐγκλίσεις τῆς κεφαλῆς εἰς τὰ δεξιά

children.definition: the inclination or slope, as of a wave, κατὰ τὴν ἔ. σκιασθῆναι Arist. Col. 792a22.
displacement, Hp. Fract. 39 (pl.): generally, ὄγκων cj. in Epicur. Ep. 1p.14U.
modulation of a singerʼs voice, D.Chr. 32.49.
failure, defeat, PMag.Par. 1.2445.
mood of a verb, D.H. Comp. 6, D.T. 638.7, A.D. Synt. 248.14, etc.
throwing back of the accent, Id. Pron. 8.7, al.; change of acute to grave accent, Id. Adv. 169.23.
inflexion, Simp. in Cat. 65.8, Dexipp. in Cat. 33.8: generally, of derivative forms, Simp. in Cat. 37.11.
one must use as enclitic, Sch. Il. 12.204, Sch. Th. Oxy. 853 vi 25.

definition: ἐγκλιτικός, ή, όν, of a word

children.definition: which leans ( ἐγκλίνει) its accent upon the one before (cf. A.D. Synt. 98.2), enclitic, Trypho ap.eund. Conj. 255.11, etc. Adv. -κῶς, ἀναγιγνώσκειν EM 124.9, A.D. Synt. 222.22, Hdn.Gr. 2.70: Comp. - ώτερον A.D. Synt. 140.28.
enclose in a collar, LXX Pr. 6.21 ( Med.).
gurgle in, Hp. Mul. 1.2.
make a splash, Hp. Morb. 1.15.
splashing, Diocl. Fr. 43.
gurgling, ‘splashy’, Hp. Acut. 62.
rinse the inside of a thing, οἴνῳ with wine, D.S. 1.91.
soak, Dsc. 5.75.
treat by clysters, τινά Id. 4.154:— Pass., to be administered as a clyster or injection, Id. 1.73, Eup. 1.197, etc.
injection, clyster, Dsc. 4.3, al.
one must give a douche, Paul.Aeg. 3.66.
spin or fasten to, Sch.rec. S. OT 1264.
grate in, in Med., Nic. Th. 911 ( ἐνικν-), Al. 368.
a piece of meat, Argive word in Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.296f.
sleep in, Mosch. 2.6 (in poet. form ἐνικν-).
hollow, scoop out, f.l. in Hdt. 2.73:— Pass., Thphr. HP 5.2.4.
in the belly:—as Subst., ἐγκοίλια, τά (sg. - ιον D.S. 1.35).
intestines, Id. 1.91, SIG 958.13 ( Ceos), LXX Le. 1.9.
ribs of a ship, belly-timbers, Thphr. HP 4.2.8, Moschio ap. Ath. 5.206f.

children.label: II
children.definition: flat-bellied, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.202.
hollow, sunken, ὀφθαλμοί Hp. Prog. 2; ἔγκοιλόν τι a sinking in of the lip, Arist. HA 604a28; τὰ ἔ. τῆς γῆς Pl. Phd. 111c: Comp. - ότερος deeper, LXX Le. 13.30.

children.label: II
children.definition: concave, Thphr. HP 7.13.1.

sleep in a place, [ ἐν σπηλαίῳ] Arist. Mir. 839a3; esp. sleep in a temple, to seek prophetic dreams or to obtain cure for a disease, Str. 11.7.1, 16.2.35, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.109c; ὑπὲρ ἐνεργείας Arr. Epict. 2.16.17.
sleep upon or after a meal, Hp. Acut. 29.
a sleeping in a temple (v. foreg.), D.S. 1.53.
for sleeping on, ψίαθοι Poll. 6.11: -τήριον, τό, grave, BSA 18.145 ( Beroea, ii B. C.).

definition: ἐγκοιμήτριον, τό, = sq., in form - ήτριν, UPZ 85.8 (ii B. C.).

children.definition: counterpane, PCair.Zen. 48.4 (iii B. C.), Ammon.p.140 V.; expld. by dormitorium, Gloss. (also ἐγκοίμ-ηθρον, ἐγκοίμ-ητρα, ib.).
night-gown, Poll. 10.123.
lull to sleep in . . , AP 7.260 ( Carph.): metaph., Hero Aut. 16.2:— Pass., IG 4.951.90 (Epid.).
to be luxurious as Coesyra (a female name in the Alcmaeonid family), ἐγκεκοισυρωμένη Ar. Nu. 48.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be embedded, μέχρι τοῦ ἡμίσους Apollod. Poliorc. 161.4; to be soaked, PLeid.X. 98.
serving for a bed, ἀκρώρειαι AP 7.626.
sleep in or on, τῷ Καπιτωλίῳ D.C. 65.8.
belonging to a bed, στρώματα EM 255.44: ἐγκοίτιον, τό, = ἐγκοίμητρον, Hsch. s.v. ἐνευναίου.
given as security, Leg.Gort. 9.35.
anything engraven, LXX Ex. 36.13 ( 39.6); engraved inscription, Inscr.Prien. 42.9 (pl.).
engraven, sculptured, ἱστορία Ath. 11.781e, cf. Inscr.Prien. 37.168 (ii B. C.), LXX 3 Ki. 6.28(29).

cut or carve upon stone, ἐ. γράμματα ἐς τὸν τάφον Hdt. 1.187, cf. IG 1(2).313.166; ἐν τᾷ στάλᾳ ib. 12(1).694.9 ( Camirus); τύποι ἐν πέτρῃσι ἐγκεκολαμμένοι, γράμματα ἐν λίθῳ ἐγκ., Hdt. 2.106, 136, al., cf. LXX 3 Ki. 6.33(35); ἐπὶ τρίποσι Hdt. 5.59; ἐπὶ πίνακος Suid. s.v. βοῦς ἕβδομος; εἰς τὸ μέτωπον Plu. Per. 21: metaph., [ νόμους] ἡ φύσις κατὰ μέσης ἐνεκόλαψε τῆς ψυχῆς Lib. Decl. 43.49.

data.quote: νόμους] ἡ φύσις κατὰ μέσης ἐνεκόλαψε τῆς ψυχῆς

children.definition: engraving, inscribing, IG 4.1484.265 (Epid.), 7.3073.11 (Lebad.).
sheathed his sword, Hsch., Suid.
gulp down, swallow up, v. Sch. ad loc., Hsch.; also expld. by ἐπὶ κόλοις βαίνειν, Suid. s.v. ἐκολαβήσας.
glue on or to, IG 1(2).373.208, LXX Za. 14.5 ( Pass.), Hero Aut. 24.2.

definition: ἐγκόλλησις, εως, Dor. ἐγκόλλᾱσις, ιος, ἡ,

children.definition: fastening, soldering, IG 4.1485.167 (Epid.).
adhering, fitting, Ph. 1.610, al.
torunda, a kind of bread, Gloss. [cf. turunda]
blowing from a bay, Arist. Mu. 394b15.
form a bay, ἠϊὼν ἐγκολπίζουσα Str. 5.4.5.
go into or follow the bay, Id. 9.5.22.
inject into the vagina, Aët. 1.126.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., with pf. Pass., take in oneʼs bosom, ὥσπερ ἑρπετὰ τοὺς ἀπορρήτους λόγους Plu. Garr. 2.508d, cf. Plot. 1.4.6; embrace, θεὸς ἐγκεκόλπισται τὰ ὅλα Ph. 1.425; περίοδος πολλοὺς ἀγκῶνας ἐγκολπιζομένη a period embracing many turns of expression, D.H. Dem. 4 (vulg. ἐγκαλλωπιζομένη) ; [ἰχθῦς] ἐ. τῇ σαγήνῃ to catch fish in the belly of the net, Alciphr. 1.18.
conceive, Porph. Gaur. 5.4.
embrace in a bay, ἄκρα πολὺν-ομένη λιμένα Dion.Byz. 53.
in or on the bosom, διδόναι τι ἐ. τῷ ἀέρι Heraclit. All. 39.
vaginal douche or clyster, Aët. 3.153.

make full and round, like the folds of a robe, Orph. A. 1183 (tm.):— Pass., ἐγκεκολπῶσθαι to be curved into a bay or bays, Arist. Mu. 393a23:— Med., put in the fold of oneʼs robe: hence metaph., ‘have in oneʼs pocket’, τὴν τοῦ Καίσαρος ἰσχύν D.C. 48.52:— Pass., to have folded round one, χιτῶνα ἐνεκεκόλπωτο Id. 62.2: metaph., ἀρετήν Mich. in EN 603.24.
bind a thing on oneself, wear it constantly, Apollod.Car. 4, 1 Ep.Pet. 5.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., = δέομαι, ἐνειλοῦμαι ( Hsch.), Epich. 7.
frock or apron, worn esp. by slaves to keep the ἐξωμίς clean, Longus 2.33, Poll. 4.119, Thd. Is. 3.20, cf. Varro ap. Non.p.870 L.
obstacle, hindrance, PSI 5.500 (iii B.C.), Al. Ex. 34.12, Hsch.

to be quick and active, esp. in service, Hom., only part. pres., with another Verb, ἐπεὶ στόρεσαν λέχος ἐγκονέουσαι in haste, Od. 7.340, Il. 24.648, cf. Critias Fr. 16 D.: later also in imper., ἐγκόνει make haste! S. Aj. 988, Ar. Ach. 1088; also ἐγκονῶμεν S. Aj. 811; ἐγκονεῖτε Id. Tr. 1255, E. HF 521; οὐ θᾶττον ἐγκονήσεις; Ar. Av. 1324: c. acc. cogn., κέλευθον ἥνπερ ἦλθες ἐγκόνει πάλιν hasten back the way by which thou camest, A. Pr. 962: c. inf., Opp. H. 4.103, Q.S. 1.157. —Rare in Prose, Luc. Anach. 4.
urge on, incite, κυσίν AP 6.268 ( Mnasalc., s. v.l.).
actively, vigorously, by perseverance, Pi. N. 3.36.
room for sprinkling sand (cf. sq. [ἐγκονίομαι]), IG 9(2).31 (Hypata, prob.).
sprinkle sand over oneself after anointing, and before wrestling, X. Smp. 3.8:— Pass., Luc. Am. 45; to be in the dust, prob. l. in Hp. Vict. 3.76.
maid-servant, Suid.
sprinkler, χρούσιος ἐ. IG 7.2420 (votive offering to Cabiri).
eagerly, Hsch.
tool for cutting stone, chisel, Luc. Somn. 3.
incision, Gal. 7.38; fracture of skull, Sor. Fract. 3, cf. Heliod. ap. Orib. 46.12.1.
steps cut in the wall of wells, etc., Ael.Dion. Fr. 90.

children.label: II
children.definition: hindrance, οἴησις προκοπῆς ἐ. Heraclit. 131, cf. Phld. D. 3.6, 1 Ep.Cor. 9.12, Vett.Val. 2.7 (pl.); material obstacle, D.S. 1.32; interruption, check, τῆς ἁρμονίας D.H. Comp. 22; τοῦ λόγου Aristid. Rh. 2p.514S., cf. Iamb. Protr. 21; κατʼ ἐγκοπάς disjointedly, Longin. 41.3.
labour without ceasing, ἔργων ἐπιμελείαις καὶ κατασκευαῖς IPE 12.40.21 ( Olbia).
wearied, AP 6.33 ( Maec.), LXX Jb. 19.2, Is. 43.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: wearisome, ib. Ec. 1.8.

children.label: III
children.definition: interrupted, checked, πρᾶξις Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.161. Adv. - πως Phld. Rh. 1.23 S.
full of manure, Hsch.
checking, hindering, Ath.Med. ap. Orib. inc. 21.8, Vett.Val. 182.12, al., Eust. 1216.52.
knock in, πάτταλον Thphr. HP 2.7.6; χιλίας (i.e. πληγὰς) ἐς τὸ νῶτον ἐγκόψαι Herod. 5.33.
engrave, τὸ ψήφισμα ἐς στήλην SIG 279.33 ( Zelea):— Med., IG 12(3).536 ( Thera).
incise, Dsc. Eup. 1.141 ( Pass.).

children.label: II
children.definition: oppose, Hp. Praec. 13; λόγον λόγῳ Olymp. in Mete. 125.9.

children.label: III
children.definition: check, hold the breath, Sor. 1.69: generally, hinder, thwart, τισί Sammelb. 4305; τῇ δικαιοδοσίᾳ f.l. in Plb. 23.1.12; delay, Act. Ap. 24.4:— Pass., ἐνεκοπτόμην τοῦ ἐλθεῖν Ep.Rom. 15.22, cf. Porph. Antr. 19.

children.label: IV
children.definition: come to a stop, Vett.Val. 260.24.
wrap up in coverlets, Ar. Nu. 10.
butt at, ἐ. ἐπί τινι πληγήν Lyc. 558.
arrange in, ἐγκοσμεῖτε τὰ τεύχεʼ . . νηΐ Od. 15.218:— Pass., εἰς ἑτέραν σύγκρισιν Simp. in Ph. 28.21 ( ἐκκ- codd.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be adorned, v.l. in Aristid. Or. 26(14).99; εὐσχημοσύνῃ LXX 4 Ma. 6.2 (v.l. ἐκκ-).
mundane, δυνάμεις Porph. Antr. 9, cf. Sall. 6, Procl. Inst. 165, Dam. Pr. 24; αἴτια Iamb. Myst. 5.3; θεοί Procl. in Alc. p.68 C.; νοῖ Id. in Prm. p.588 S.

definition: ἐγκοσμογενεῖς τοὺς ἅμα τῷ κόσμῳ ἐγκριθέντας, Hsch.

children.definition: to be indignant at, τινί A. Ch. 41 (lyr.), S. Fr. 1042, LXX Ge. 27.41.

definition: ἐγκότημα, ατος, τό, = sq. [ἐγκότησις], LXX Je. 31(48).39, Hsch.

children.definition: anger at one, hatred, Aq. Ho. 9.7.
Apollon. Lex.
bearing a grudge, spiteful, malignant, στύγος A. Ch. 392 (lyr.); of the Erinyes, ib. 924, 1054; φθόνος AP 7.40 ( Diod.). Adv. - τως, ἔχειν Ph. 2.520.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. ἔγκοτος, ὁ, grudge, ἔγκοτον ἔχειν τινί Hdt. 3.59, 9.110; τινός for a thing, Id. 8.29; διά τι Id. 6.73, cf. 133; also ἔγκοτον, τό, D.H. 9.7.
a game of pick-a-back, in which a boy was carried about kneeling on the hollow of anotherʼs folded hands ( κοτύλαι) (cf. Poll. 9.122), Ath. 11.479a, Paus.Gr. Fr. 143.
painting on the ceiling, A. Fr. 142; also pl., = τὰ ἐν τῷ προσώπῳ στίγματα, Hsch.
Hsch.
to cry aloud at one, esp. in anger, τινί v.l. in Ar. Pl. 428; ἐπί τινα v.l. in Th. 8.84; φωνεῖν ὀξὺ καὶ ἐγκεκραγός Arist. Phgn. 813b5.
to be drunk at or with, τρυφῇ Hdn. 2.10.6:—also ἐγκραιπᾰλ-ίζω, dub. in Phld. Rh. 1.173 S.
cerebellum, Gal. UP 8.6:—also ἐγ-κρᾱνίς, ίδος, ἡ, ib. 11.
blending of sounds, Nicom. Harm. 2: metaph., multiplication of numbers, κατʼ ἔγκρασιν, opp. κατὰ σύνθεσιν (addition), Theol.Ar. 9,37.
anchovy, Arist. HA 569b27, Call. Fr. 38, Ael. NA 8.18.
mastery over, ἐ. ἑαυτοῦ self- control, Pl. R. 390b; ἐ. ἡδονῶν καὶ ἐπιθυμιῶν control over them, ib. 430e, cf. X. Mem. 2.1.1, Isoc. 1.21; περί τι Arist. EN 1149a21, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: self-control, X. Mem. 1.5.1, Isoc. 3.44, Arist. EN 1145b8, al., LXX Si. 18.30, Act.Ap. 24.25, etc.
instance of self-control, Iamb. VP 17.72 (pl.).
exercise self-control, Arist. EE 1223b12, LXX Ge. 43.31, 1 Ep.Cor. 7.9; force oneself to do a thing, LXX 1 Ki. 13.12; starve oneself, Vett.Val. 127.20 (cf. ἀποκαρτερεῖν).

children.label: II
children.definition: to be a member of the Encratite sect, Anatolian Studies 87 ( Phrygia).
ascetic, esp. faster, Eust. 554.8.
to be master of, exercise control over, τῶ ἀλόγω Metop. ap. Stob. 3.1.115, cf. LXX Ex. 9.2.
in possession of power, S. OT 941.

children.label: II
children.definition: holding fast, χεὶρ -εστάτη a hand with the firmest hold, X. Eq. 7.8.
stout, strong, ἐ. σθένει A. Pr. 55; τὸν -έστατον σίδηρον S. Ant. 474; ἐ. σῶμα X. HG 7.1.23.

children.label: III
children.definition: having possession of, χωρέων Hdt. 8.49, cf. 9.106, S. Ph. 75, SIG 58.7 ( Milet., v B. C.), etc.; ναὸς ἐγκρατῆ πόδα the sheet that controls the ship, S. Ant. 715; ἐ. αὑτῶν masters of themselves, Pl. Phdr. 256b, al.; ἐ. ἀφροδισίων καὶ γαστρός X. Mem. 1.2.1, cf. 2.1.7, Oec. 12.16.
master of oneself, self-controlled, Pl. Def. 415d; self-disciplined, Arist. EN 1145b13, al.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Adv. - τῶς, Ion. -τέως Hp. Foet.Exsect. 4, etc.; with a strong hand, by force, ἄρχειν Th. 1.76; ἐ. ἔχειν τὴν ἀρχήν Arist. Pol. 1284a40; - τέως forcibly, Theoc. 25.266.
with self-control, temperately, ἐ. ἔχειν Pl. Lg. 710a; φέρειν τι D.Chr. 2.53; -τέως Archestr. Fr. 23.20.
holding in the breath, D.L. 6.77.
member of the Encratite sect, Cod.Theod. 16.5.9.
Phld. Rh. 2.62 S.
shout at a person, Phld. Lib. p.5 O. ( Pass.).

definition: ἐγκρέκων σφυγμός, term coined by Archig. ap. Gal. 8.662.

children.definition: to be hung up in, Gp. 2.4.2, al.
suspension, Hp. Art. 76 (v.l. ἐκκρ-).
dealer in ἐγκρίδες, Ar. Fr. 256, Nicopho 19.
Hsch., Theognost. Can. 164.27.
enclose as in a ring, bind as in a hoop, Hp. Oss. 18.
to be suspended, Hp. Art. 76 (v.l. ἐκκρ-).
reckon in or among: reckon as, τίνʼ ἄνδρʼ ἄριστον ἐγκρίναιεν ἄν; E. HF 183.

select, admit, ἐ. ἢ συγκρ. 2 Ep.Cor. 10.12:— Pass., εἰς τὴν αἵρεσιν Pl. Lg. 755d; εἰς τὴν γερουσίαν D. 20.107; <εἰς> τὸ στάδιον X. HG 4.1.40; of ἔφηβοι, IG 7.29 (iii/ii B. C.); of athletes, Artem. 1.59; ἐγκρινόμενος, ὁ, subject of statue by Alcamenes, Plin. HN 34.72.

admit, accept, opp. ἀποκρίνω, Pl. Lg. 936a; ἐν τοῖς φιλοσόφοις Id. R. 486d, cf. Lg. 952a, al.; τρία γένη σημείων Phld. Sign. 32; παλιγγενεσίαν Sch. Pi. O. 2.104; regard as genuine, νομίσματα Phld. Rh. 1.256 S.; admit, sanction, e.g. an author as classical, Suid. s.v. Δείναρχος.
approve, Plb. 9.2.4 ( Pass.), Plu. Lib.educ. 2.11f; ἀριθμὸς ἐγκρίνεται is adopted, Ael. Tact. 8.3.
a cake made with oil and honey, Stesich. 2, Pherecr. 83, Antiph. 275, LXX Ex. 16.31, Ph. 1.214; also expld. as, = ἀμανίτης, Hsch.
approval, judgement, IG 9(2).338.17 (Epist. Flaminini).
examination of athletes before admitting them to a contest, Luc. Pr.Im. 11, Artem. 1.59, Aristid. Or. 29(40).18 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: junction, meeting, ἡ ἐπὶ τοὺς μηροὺς ἔ. Alciphr. 1.

senses.definition: one must admit, εἰς ἀριθμόν τινα, opp. ἀποκρ-, Pl. R. 537a, cf. 413d; διορισμὸν ἐ. ὡς πιθανώτατον Dam. Pr. 436, cf. Jul. Or. 7.219a; one must approve, recommend, αἰώρας Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.86: also pl. ἐγκριτέα ib. 112.

children.definition: of or for admission: ἐ. οἶκοι rooms where the athletes were examined before they were admitted as candidates, IG 4.203.12 ( Corinth, ii A. D.).
admitted, accepted, Pl. Lg. 966d, IG 12(9).189.9 ( Eretria, iv B. C.); ἔ. θεά Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.106.
spread oneself in, διηγήσεσιν Eust. 1050.31.
= Lat. incrustare, veneer with marble, Supp.Epigr. 2.698 ( Attalia).

strike on the ground, ἐς ἓν μέλος ἐγκροτέοισαι ποσσίν beating time with the feet to one tune, Theoc. 18.7:— Med., πυγμαὶ δʼ ἦσαν ἐγκροτούμεναι the fists were dashing one against the other, E. IT 1368.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be fastened by nails, τοίχῳ Philostr. VA 2.20.
knock or hammer in, παττάλους εἰς τὸν τοῖχον Ar. V. 130; ἥλους εἰς τὰ ὑποδήματα Thphr. Char. 4.13; strike, ἐγκρούουσα ποσσὶ λάλους πτέρυγας, of the locust, AP 7.195.4 ( Mel.).

children.label: II
children.definition: dance, Ar. Ra. 374.

definition: ἐγκρύβω [ῠ], late form of ἐγκρύπτω, D.S. 1.80 ( Pass.), Apollod. 3.13.6, Gal. 6.620, PHolm. 5.7.

children.definition: anything concealed, an ambuscade, Eust. 932.17.
one must bury, cover up, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.8.10.
Hsch.
hide or conceal in, δαλὸν σποδιῇ ἐνέκρυψε μελαίνῃ Od. 5.488, cf. Sotad.Com. 1.29; [ ᾠὰ] ἐν δέρματι λαγωοῦ Arist. HA 619b15; τι εἴς τι Ev.Matt. 13.33, Apollod. 1.5.1 ( Pass.), etc.
πῦρ ἐ. bank it up, Ar. Av. 841.
Med., hide oneself, μελάθροις Nonn. D. 32.285.
keep oneself hidden, act underhand, Ar. Eq. 822.
hide, conceal, πάθος Procop. Arc. 1: abs., Id. Vand. 1.25.
baked in the ashes, Hp. Vict. 2.42, Nicostr.Com. 14, Luc. DMort. 6[20].4, Ath. 3.110b.
= sq., πῦρ AP 5.123 ( Phld.).
hidden, ἥβη Nonn. D. 28.295.
impf. ἐνέκρῠφεν Q.S. 14.556, Nonn. D. 6.135.
banking up of a fire, Arist. Juv. 470a12.

acquire possessions in a foreign country, πόλιν ἐν Θρηΐκῃ (v.l. for ἐγκτις-) Hdt. 5.23; οἱ ἐγκεκτημένοι citizens who possess property in a deme not their own, opp. δημόται, D. 50.8, cf. X. Vect. 2.4, PGnom. 243.
bury in, τύμβῳ A.R. 1.1060, cf. Tryph. 179.
land held in a country by a person not belonging to it, And. 3.15, D. 7.42, IG 2(2).43.27, App. Mith. 47.

tenure of land in a country or district by a person not belonging to it, X. HG 5.2.19 (pl.); the right of holding such property, freq. granted as a privilege or reward to foreigners, ἔγκτασιν γᾶς καὶ οἰκιᾶν Decr.Byz. ap. D. 18.91, cf. IG 5(1).4.12 ( Sparta), etc.; εἶναι δὲ αὐτῷ οἰκίας ἔγκτησιν ib. 2(2).53.
estate, property, LXX Le. 25.13, etc.; βιβλιοθήκη ἐγκτήσεων register of properties, BGU 76 (ii A. D.), etc.
acquisition of territory, Plb. 28.20.8 (prob. l.).
a land-tax paid for the right of holding ἐγκτήματα, IG 2(2).1214.
possessed in a foreign country, LXX Le. 14.34, al.
landowner, Keil-Premerstein Dritter Bericht 86.
found, build among, πόλεις ἔθνεσιν Plu. Alex. fort. 2.328e:— Med., πόλιν ἐν Θρηΐκῃ v.l. in Hdt. 5.23 (cf. ἐγκτάομαι).
pregnant, ὄϊς Schwyzer 725.6 ( Milet., vi B.C.).

to be borne in the womb, Theon Prog. 2.
germination, in plants, Thphr. CP 1.6.3.

roll or rotate in the sockets, of the joints, Hp. de Arte 10.

children.label: III

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐγκυκλήματα, τά, movable property, Arist. Oec. 1346a13.
revolve, τὰ ὀπίσθια Hippiatr. 30.

definition: ἐγκύκλιος, ον, also α, ον Orph. A. 981: ( κύκλος):—

children.definition: circular, round, χοροί E. IT 429 (lyr.), Aeschin. 1.10; τὸ ἐ. σῶμα Arist. Cael. 286a11; ἐ. κίνησις, φορά, motion in a circle, ib. 293a11, 296a35; δρόμημα θεῶν Corp.Herm. 3.3. Adv. - ίως in a circle, φέρεσθαι Arist. Mete. 339a12, cf. Euc. Phaen. p.2 M., Hero Aut. 11.8, Plu. QPlat. 2.1004c; καθῆσθαι Asp. in EN 10.31.

children.label: II
children.definition: revolving in a cycle, recurrent: hence, at Athens, λῃτουργίαι ἐ. public services required regularly every year, opp. to those required at uncertain times, D. 20.21; ἐ. δίκαια rights common to all citizens, Id. 25.74.

children.label: III
children.definition: ordinary, everyday, ἐν τοῖς ἐ. καὶ τοῖς καθʼ ἡμέραν γιγνομένοις Isoc. 3.22, cf. 8.87, Arist. Pol. 1269b35; ἐ. διακονίαι everyday duties, ib. 1263a21; τὰ ἐ. καὶ πολιτικά Epicur. Sent.Vat. 58; ἡ ἐ. διοίκησις IG 12 (5).653.56 ( Syros, i B.C.); ἐ. ἀναλώματα ib. 1.329; ἐ. [τέλη] taxes farmed out annually, ib. 11(2).161 A 36, 203 A 29 ( Delos, iii B. C.); ταμίαι τῶν ἐ. SIG 577.11 ( Milet., iii/ii B. C.).

data.quote: ἐν τοῖς ἐ. καὶ τοῖς καθʼ ἡμέραν γιγνομένοις

children.label: b
children.definition: μεγάλοις ἐ. συμπτώμασιν (sc. πάθος) commonly liable to, Phld. Ir. p.29 W.
Arist., τὰ ἐ. φιλοσοφήματα or τὰ ἐ., = τὰ ἐξωτερικά, Cael. 279a30; ἐν τοῖς ἐ. εἴρηται EN 1096a3.

ἐ. παιδεία general education, prior to professional studies, D.H. Comp. 25, Plu. Mus. 2.1135d; οἱ περὶ τὰ ἐ. παιδευταί Id. Alex. 7; τὰ ἐ. παιδεύματα Id. Lib.educ. 2.7c, cf. Vitr. 6 Praef. 4, Quint. Inst. 1.10.1, Ath. 4.184b, Luc. Am. 45; also ἐ. ἀγωγή instruction in general knowledge, Str. 1.1.22; ἐ. τέχνη Olymp.Alch. p.91 B.

definition: ἐγκυκλοπαιδεία, f. l. for ἐγκύκλιος παιδεία, Quint. Inst. 1.10.1, cf. Plin. HN Praef.

children.definition: circular, δίνη Epicur. Ep. 2p.52U.; round, Matro Conv. 116, Ezek. Exag. 77. Adv. -ως Gal. 18(2).439.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἔγκυκλον, τό, womanʼs upper garment, Ar. Th. 261, Lys. 113; ἐ. ποικίλον IG 2.754.48.

V. 699; φωνή μέ τις ἐγκεκύκλωται a voice has echoed around me, ib. 395; surround, hem in, Plu. Marc. 6, etc.; of rivers or mountains, Str. 2.1.36, D.C. 49.37: Pass., to be surrounded, Id. 56.12 (s. v.l.).
wander, roam about, ἐγκυκλωθῆναι Σικελίαν D.S. 4.23, etc.
surrounding, encompassing, Str. 2.1.36.
rolled up, ἔριον Hp. Mul. 1.75.
rolling among, ἐν πόρναις Plu. Oth. 2.

definition: ἐγκυλίνδω ( ἐγκυλῑω Hp. Mul. 1.75, Arist. Pr. 914a22, Vett.Val. 118.15, etc.), fut. - κυλίσω [ῑ]:—

children.definition: roll or wrap up in, πολλοῖς ἐμαυτὸν ἐγκυλῖσαι πράγμασιν Pherecr. 146.2; τι ἐς ἔριον Hp. l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be involved in, εἰς ἔρωτας ἐγκυλισθείς X. Mem. 1.2.22, cf. Vett.Val. l.c.; εἰς τὰς πολιτικὰς πράξεις D.H. 11.36; ἐν κακοῖς Porph. Chr. 26; πράγμασι Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.208:—in aor. Med., ἐγκυλίσασθαι Luc. Hipp. 6.
Ar. Nu. 32.
part., Vett.Val. 118.17 (pl.).
on the waves, ὁδοιπορία Secund. Sent. 17.
become pregnant, Gp. 14.26.2; τὸν Δία conceive, Apollod. 1.1.5.

children.definition: pregnant, X. Cyn. 7.2, Arist. HA 546b10, etc.; ἐ. γενέσθαι ὑπό τινος Id. Fr. 76; ἵππος ἐ. τευχέων big with arms, of the Trojan horse, E. Tr. 11; ἐ. ἄμυλος Pl.Com. 174.8; πόα ἐ. σπέρματος Dsc. 3.7: metaph., of the mind, Pl. Smp. 209b, Ph. 1.651, etc.; καμάτων ἐγκύμονα βίβλον AP 9.210.
impregnate: metaph. of a chemical reaction, Zos. Alch. p.211 B.

Hdt. 1.5, 6.131, Hp. Aph. 5.42, etc.; πῶλος ἡσυχίης ἔγκυος, of the Trojan horse, AP 9.156 ( Antiphil.); γαστρὸς ἀπωσαμέναν μόρον ἔγκυον, of one dying in child-birth, Epigr Gr. 238 ( Smyrna), cf. IG 12(7).301 ( Amorgos).
Arist. HA 595b27.

stoop down and peep in, ἐ. εἴς τι look closely into, Hdt. 7.152; κατὰ [τὰς θυρίδας] Pl. R. 359d: abs., ἐγκεκυφότες stooping to the ground, Ar. Nu. 191, Th. 4.4; δάκτυλοι ἐγκύπτοντες retracted, Hp. Hebd. 51.
meeting with or happening, Phld. Rh. 1.71 S., S.E. P. 1.37.
definite phenomenon, BKT 3p.30.
Heraclit. 17 (s.v.l.).
passages into the κύρτος or creel or fish-trap, to which Pl. compares the throat, Ti. 78b-d, cf. Gal. ad loc.p.20 D.
curved or crooked, Hp. Mochl. 1, Arist. Pr. 908b29.
curvature, Cass. Pr. 38.

definition: ἐγκύρω [ῡ], impf. ἐνέκῡρον: fut. ἐγκύρσω: aor. ἐνέκυρσα:— Pass., ἐγκύρομαι: ἐγκῠρέω, aor. 1 ἐνεκύρησα, less freq. in early writers, Heraclit. 72, freq. in Phld. as Sign. 21, al., cf. Plb. and D.H. (v. infr.), Ael. Tact. 1.2:—

children.definition: fall in with, light upon, meet with, c.dat., ἐνέκυρσε φάλαγξι Il. 13.145; ἐγκύρσας ἀάτῃσιν Hes. Op. 216; ὁκοίοις ἐγκυρέωσιν ἔργμασι Archil. 70; ἐγκύρσαις ( Aeol. aor. 1 part.) ἑκατονταετεῖ βιοτᾷ Pi. P. 4.282, cf. 1.100; δύᾳ B. Fr. 21; τμητοῖς ὁλκοῖς ἐγκῦρσαι S. El. 863 (lyr.); στρατῷ ἐνέκυρσε ἀμφοτέρῃσι τῇσι μοίρῃσι Hdt. 4.125; ἐνεκύρησαν στρατῷ Id. 7.218, cf. Plb. 8.35.5, etc.; δυσχωρίαις ἐγκυρήσαντες D.H. 3.59; τυράννοις Phld. Ir. p.30 W.: in Hdt. 7.208, c. gen., ἀλογίης ἐνέκυρσε πολλῆς (here Valck. proposed ἐκύρησε, which has been received by edd.): c. acc., Ἅιδαν ἐγκύρσαντες ἀλάμπετον Epigr.Gr. 241 ( Smyrna). —Not in Att. Prose, once in Com., ἐγκυρῆσαι Cratin. 35.
Com.Adesp. 6 D.
Hsch.
to the skin, ἐγκυτὶ κεκαρμένος close shaven, Archil. 37, cf. Call. Fr. 311. [ ῐ Archil., ῐ Call.]
curvature, Gal. 8.246.
trunculus, Gloss.

definition: ἐγκωλύω, aor. ἐνεκώλυσα, f.l. for ἐνεκόλλησα, Hero Aut. 24.2.

definition: ἐγκωμιάζω, impf. ἐνεκωμίαζον Aeschin. 3.86: fut. - άσω Pl. Grg. 518e, 519a, Isoc. 12.111, but - άσομαι Pl. Smp. 198d, Aeschin. 1.33: aor. ἐνεκωμίασα Pl. La. 191b: pf. ἐγκεκωμίακα Id. Lg. 629c, Isoc. 7.71: — Pass., aor. ἐγκωμιασθείς Hdt. 5.5: pf. ἐγκεκωμίασμαι Pl. Smp. 177c (the tenses being formed as if the Verb were a compound of ἐν and *κωμιάζω, and not derived directly from ἐγκώμιος):—

children.definition: praise, laud, extol, c. dupl. acc., ταῦτα τὴν δικαιοσύνην Id. R. 363d; τινὰ ἐπὶ σοφίᾳ Id. Euthphr. 9b; κατὰ τοῦτο Id. La. 191b; περὶ τὴν μάχην Id. Tht. 142b; τὴν τέχνην τινός Id. Grg. 448e: abs., Phld. Herc. 1457.8:— Pass., to be praised, Hdt. 5.5, Pl. Smp. 181a; to be said in panegyric, Phld. Herc. 1457 Fr. 14, etc.
one must eulogize, Phld. Rh. 1.219 S., S.E. M. 2.101; θεούς Hermog. Prog. 7.
praiser, panegyrist, Str. 15.1.68, Plu. Exil. 2.605a.

to be praised, Ph. 1.453.
IG 12(9).95a ( Tamynae).
panegyric-writer, Artem. 1.56 (pl.); εἰς τὸν αὐτοκράτορα IG 7.1773.11 ( Thebes).
metre used in ἐγκώμια, Heph. 15.10.

Subst. ἐγκώμιον, τό, laudatory ode, D.S. 11.11, Ath. 13.573f; generally, eulogy, panegyric, Ar. Nu. 1205, D. 18.207 (pl.), Thphr. Char. 3.2, etc.; ἐγκώμια παλαιῶν ἀνδρῶν Pl. Prt. 326a; ἐ. εἴς τινα, κατά τινος, Pl. Min. 319c, D. 6.9; ἐ. λογικόν in prose, IG 7.2727 ( Acraephia); ἐ. ἐπικόν ib. 419 ( Oropus); ὁ ἔπαινος τῆς ἀρετῆς, opp. τὰ ἐ. τῶν ἔργων, Arist. EN 1101b33, cf. Rh. 1367b28.

ἔγρω.

waking, wakefulness, Hp. Hum. 9, Arist. HA 536b24, Ph. 1.71, al., Onos. 10.11, D.Chr. 3.85, Plot. 6.8.16; περὶ ὕπνου καὶ ἐγρηγόρσεως, title of work by Arist. ἐγρηγορ-τέον, one must keep awake, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.6.3.

Them. 9; insert in a document, CPR 19.18 (iv A.D.): metaph., imitate, ἐ. τὸν Ἀντισθένειον τύπον Jul. Alex. 58; δραχμαὶ ἐγκεχαραγμέναι γράμμασιν Ἑλληνικοῖς ἐπίσημα Peripl.M.Rubr. 47; of soldiers, to be entered on a muster-roll, Agath. 5.15.

Ichn. 343; ἐγχανεῖται ταῖς ἐμαῖς τύχαισι Ar. Ach. 1197; ἐγχανεῖται τῇ πόλει Id. Eq. 1313: c. part., μὴ γὰρ ἐγχάνῃ ποτὲ . . ἐκφυγών let him not taunt [us] with his having escaped, Id. Ach. 221.

Mem. 2.3.12, etc.; τὸν ἐγχειρήσαντα συκοφαντεῖν Hyp. Eux. 34: abs., to make an attempt or beginning, S. El. 1026, Th. 4.4, etc.
