Char. 30.15; ἐ. τινί τὴν φυλακήν Arist. Pol. 1306a22; ἐ. ἐμαυτὸν τῇ ἀτυχίᾳ Antipho 2.4.1, etc.:— Pass., to be entrusted, τινί to one, Plb. 5.44.1; τὴν ἐγχειρισθεῖσαν ἑαυτῷ πίστιν IG 2(2).1028.72; ἡ -ισθεῖσά τινι χρεία PFlor. 2.9 (iii A.D.); but ἐγχειρίζεσθαί τι to be entrusted with a thing, Luc. Prom. 3, Am. 39, Hdn. 1.12.3, etc.: c. inf., διοικεῖν τὰ τῆς ἀρχῆς ἐγκεχειρίσμεθα we have been entrusted with the administration of the government, Id. 8.7.5:— Med., take in hand, encounter, κινδύνους Th. 5.108, D.C. Fr. 29.6, v.l. in S.E. P. 1.91.

children.label: II
children.definition: treat surgically, Hippiatr. 18.
put into oneʼs hands, ἐ. τινα παραδιδόναι Hdt. 5.106: Aeol. ἐγχερρίθετος prob. in Sapph. Oxy. 1787 Fr. 9.
one must undertake, Aët. 6.22.
Cleanth. ap. Clearch. 16, Zonar.
elect, Poll. 2.150.

Dim. of ἔγχελυς, in sg., Ar. Fr. 318.7, Antiph. 222.4: mostly in pl., Pherecr. 108.12, Callias Com. 3, Posidipp. 14; ὀπτᾶτε τἀγχέλεια Ar. Ach. 1043: but in ll.cc. prob. neut. pl. of ἐγχέλειος (sc. κρέα or τεμάχη); so τέμαχος ἐγχέλειον Pherecr. 45, cf. Eust. 1231.36.
eel-trap, Arist. HA 592a4, 16.
Arist. Fr. 311.

definition: ἐγχελύδιον [ῡ], τό, Dim. of ἔγχελυς, Amphis 35, Ephipp. 15.6.

children.definition: keeping eels, Arist. HA 592a2, Fr. 311.

definition: ἔγχελυς Matro Conv. 39, acc. - ῠν Archestr. Fr. 8 (the accent ἐγχέλυς, etc., is sts. found as v.l.), ἡ ( ὁ, is f.l. in Luc. Anach. 1), Att. gen. εως, nom. pl. εις, cf. Ael.Dion. Fr. 145; gen. pl. ἐγγέλεων acc. to Choerob. in Theod. 1.331; but the Ion. forms - υος, -υες or - υς, -ύων, -υσι are freq. found as v.l. in Arist. HA; dat. sg. - υϊ Hp. Mul. 2.115; acc. pl. ἐγχέλυας Archil. 101:—

children.definition: eel, ἐγχέλυές τε καὶ ἰχθύες Il. 21.203, cf. Epich. 73, Arist. HA 538a3, al., etc.; ἐ. Κωπαΐδας Ar. Ach. 880; ἐ. Βοιώτιαι Antiph. 236: prov., ἐγχέλεις θηρᾶσθαι, i.e. to ‘fish in troubled waters’, Ar. Eq. 864, cf. Nu. 559, Arist. HA 592a6.
eel-faced, Luc. VH 1.35.
IG 2(2).1126.4 (Decr. Amphict.).
raging with the spear, EM 313.7, Hsch.
fighting with the spear, Il. 2.692, al., Od. 3.188, Cerc. 6.9: Comp., with play on μῶρος, AP 11.16. (- μωρος is perh. cogn. with μάρναμαι.)
wielders of the spear, Hsch.
living by war, Orph. Fr. 285.18.
wielding the spear, Il. 2.131, B. 5.69, etc.
spear-bearing, Pi. N. 3.61.

definition: ἐγχέω, Ep. subj. ἐγχείῃ (v. infr.): fut. - χέω, late ἐγχύσω f.l. in Hero Spir. 1.33: aor. ἐνέχεα, Ep. ἐνέχευα, but 3 pl. ἐνέχεαν in tmesi Od. 8.436; imper. ἔγχεον E. Cyc. 568: pf. Pass. ἐγκέχῠμαι:—

children.definition: pour in, ἐν δʼ οἶνον ἔχευεν Od. 3.40, 6.77; μέθυ . . ἐγχείῃ δεπάεσσι 9.10; ἔγχεε κέρναις ἔνα καὶ δύο Alc. 41.4; οἶνον ἐς κύλικα Hdt. 4.70; ὄξος τʼ ἄλειφά τʼ ἐγχέας ταὐτῷ κύτει A. Ag. 322; φάρμακα X. Cyr. 1.3.9; κἂν οἶνόν μοι μὴ ʼγχῃς σὺ πιεῖν Ar. V. 616; ἐγχεῖν alone, fill the cup, τοῖς νεανίσκοις ἐγχεῖν ἐκέλευε X. An. 4.3.13, cf. Pl. Smp. 214a: c. gen., in honour of, τινός Call. Epigr. 31, AP 5.135, 136 ( Mel.): also c. dat., ἔγχει καὶ Κήδωνι Scol. 27; ἐγχεῖν σπονδήν pour in wine for a libation, Ar. Pax 1102, Antipho 1.19:— Med., ὕδωρ δʼ ἐνεχεύατο πουλύ (with no med. sense) Od. 19.387; but in strict sense of Med., pour in wine for oneself, fill oneʼs cup, Ar. V. 617; εἰς τὴν χεῖρα ἐγχέασθαι pour [wine] into oneʼs own hand, X. Cyr. 1.3.9; ποτὸν ἐγχεῖσθαι Id. Smp. 2.26.

data.quote: ὄξος τʼ ἄλειφά τʼ ἐγχέας ταὐτῷ κύτει
κἂν οἶνόν μοι μὴ ʼγχῃς σὺ πιεῖν

children.definition: pour in, shoot in, ἐν δέ μοι ἄλφιτα χεῦον . . δοροῖσιν Od. 2.354.

data.quote: ἐν δέ μοι ἄλφιτα χεῦον . . δοροῖσιν

children.label: b
children.definition: ἐ. ἐς τὰς ῥῖνας πτερά thrust in, Ar. Av. 1081.
infuse, instil, in Pass., πᾶσιν ἡμῖν θανάσιμον -κέχυται τὸ τῆς γενέσεως φάρμακον Metrod. 53; τὸ δʼ αὖ τῆς ἡδονῆς πολὺ πλέον ἐγκεχυμένον Pl. Phlb. 47a.

data.quote: πᾶσιν ἡμῖν θανάσιμον -κέχυται τὸ τῆς γενέσεως φάρμακον
τὸ δʼ αὖ τῆς ἡδονῆς πολὺ πλέον ἐγκεχυμένον

children.label: II
children.definition: fill by pouring in, κρατῆρα S. Fr. 563; φιάλην X. Smp. 2.23; ἔγχεον . . Διός γε τήνδε σωτῆρος Alex. 232; ἐγχέασα . . ἀγαθοῦ δαίμονος (sc. κύλικα) Nicostr. 20.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἐγχεῖν ὕδωρ τινί (v. κλεψύδρα) D. 19.213, cf. 43.8:— Pass., ἐγχεῖται τὸ πρῶτον ὕδωρ Aeschin. 3.197.
bandage, Hsch. ἐγχημώμενοι· ἐγχάσκοντες, Id. (leg. ἐγχασμ-). ἐγχηρωτύλει· ἐπιχαίρουσιν, Id.
in the earth, σποδιὴ κειμένη ἐ. Epigr.Gr. 298, prob. in AP 7.740 ( Leon.).

children.label: II
children.definition: of the country, κύλιξ APl. 16.235 ( Apollonid.).
making a noise with the spear, EM 630.26.
to be clothed in, ἐσθῆτα Lyc. 974, cf. 1347.
to be wrapped in a cloak, Hsch. s.v. ἐντεθετταλίσθαι.
warm, in Pass., Dsc. Eup. 1.228.
to deal wantonly with, insult, Ἕλλησιν A. Supp. 914.
to be of a greenish hue, Nic. Th. 154.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐγχλοᾶσθαι· ἐμφῦναι, Hsch.
Nic. Th. 506, al.; metapl. acc. ἔγχλοα ib. 676.
Nic. Th. 154.
greenish, Thphr. HP 3.12.5 ( Comp.), Dsc. 3.37.
downy, Nic. Th. 762, Dsc. 3.146.
Hsch.
form into grains, Archig. ap. Gal. 12.661.
in grains, of manna, Dsc. 1.68.6.
stringed, Poll. 4.58.
dance in, ἐν Ἰνδίᾳ Plu. Alex. fort. 2.332b: generally, disport oneself, take pleasure in, παιδεύμασι, etc., Ph. 1.252, al.; of birds, sport in the air, c. acc., Vett.Val. 344.22 (s. v.l.).
grass-grown, POxy. 1911.103 (vi A. D.), 1912.134 (vi A. D.).
spear, lance, Il. 6.319, etc.; ἔ. λογχωτά B. Fr. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: weapon in general: sword, S. Aj. 287, al., E. El. 696, etc.: pl., weapons, ἄτερ ἐγχέων Pi. P. 9.28; πτερωτὰ ἔγχη arrows, E. HF 1098; πῦρ . . Ἑκάτης ἔγχος S. Fr. 535 (anap.); of Nausicaaʼs ball, τὸ δʼ ἔ. ἐν ποσὶν κυλίνδεται ib. 782: metaph., φροντίδος ἔ. Id. OT 170 (lyr.).

children.label: III
children.definition: armed force, Ἰηπύγων ἔγχος ἀπωσάμενοι Call. Fr. 444.

definition: ἔγχουσα, ἡ, Att. for ἄγχουσα (q. v.), Ar. Lys. 48, X. Oec. 10.2.

children.definition: rouge, τὸ πρόσωπον, EM 313.37; cf. ἀγχουσίζομαι.
impf. ἐνέχουν Str. 7.4.7:— Pass., ἐγχούμενοι πόροι Id. 9.2.18.

definition: ἐγχράω and ἐγχραύω, Ep. ἐνιχραύω Nic. Th. 277:—like ἐγχρίμπτω,

children.definition: dash against, ἐνέχραυεν ἐς τὸ πρόσωπον τὸ σκῆπτρον Hdt. 6.75; κυνόδοντά τισι Nic. l.c.

data.quote: ἐνέχραυεν ἐς τὸ πρόσωπον τὸ σκῆπτρον

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., ἦσαν δὲ πρός τινας καὶ ἄλλους ἐγκεχρημένοι (sc. πόλεμοι) there were wars undertaken . . , Hdt. 7.145 (prob. f.l. for ἐγκεκρημένοι).
to neigh in, Poll. 10.56.
spitting, in pl., Plu. Profect. 2.82b (dub. l.).
expectorate, Luc. Gall. 10.
want, have need of, c. gen., ib. 1.3 S., POxy. 1766.10 (iii A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: to be needful or useful, εἰς ὕδωρ Gp. 20.19 tit.; ἰατροῖς ἐγχρῄζει τὸ ψέγειν prob. in Phld. Ir. p.21 W., cf. BGU 226.9 (i A.D.), Apollon. Mir. 36; τὰ ἐγχρῄζοντα necessaries, condemned by Luc. Hist.Conscr. 22.
execute a deed, PPetr. 2p.43.

definition: ἐγχρίμπτω or ἐγ-χρίπτω, Philostr. VA 8.19 (also- χριπτᾶται· ἐγγίζει, Hsch.): aor. ἐνέχριμψα Il. 23.334, Hdt. 2.60 (v.l.- χρίψαντες):— Med., fut. -χρίμψομαι A.R. 4.939:— Pass., aor. ἐνεχρίμφθην Il. 23.338:—

children.definition: bring near to, with collat. notion of force, strike or dash against, τῷ [τέρματι] σὺ μάλʼ ἐγχρίμψας ἐλάαν σχεδὸν ἅρμα drive the chariot close so as almost to touch the post, ib. 334 (so ἐν νύσσῃ δέ τοι ἵππος . . ἐγχριμφθήτω let him almost touch the post, ib. 338); ἐ. τὴν βᾶριν τῇ γῇ to bring the boat close to land, Hdt. 2.60; ἐ. (sc. τὴν ναῦν) τῷ αἰγιαλῷ Id. 9.98; ἐ. τὸν ἵππον τῇ θηλέῃ Id. 3.85; ἐ. ἐς τὴν γῆν App. BC 5.81.

children.label: II
children.definition: approach, τινί S. El. 898:—more freq. in Pass. in this sense, ἐγχριμφθείς having come near to assault one, Il. 13.146; ἐνιχριμφθέντα πύλῃσιν 17.405; αἰχμὴ ὀστέῳ ἐγχριμφθεῖσα the point driven to the very bone, 5.662; ἀσπίδʼ (i.e. ἀσπίδι) ἐνιχριμφθείς dashed against his shield, 7.272; νωλεμὲς ἐγχρίμπτοντο they pressed unceasing on, 17.413; later, keep close to, ἐ. (sc. τῇ γῇ), of fish, Hdt. 2.93; ἐν οὔδει Maiist. 24; ἐ. γυναικί, = πλησιάζω, Hdt. 4.113; κύνες ἐλάφοις ἐγχριμπτόμεναι pursuing them, E. Hipp. 218 (anap.); of serpents, attack, τινί v.l. for - σκίμψῃ in Nic. Th. 336, cf. A.R. 4.1512, Philostr. l.c.; of elephants, Opp. C. 2.535; of disease, attack a particular part, ἐς τοὺς βουβῶνας Hp. Mul. 2.137; ἀρθρῖτις ἐ. ἐς ἄρθρα Aret. SD 2.12.—Poet., Ion. and late Prose.
anointing, rubbing in, Hp. Decent. 8.

children.label: II
children.definition: slight wound, scratch, Ael. NA 3.22.
liniment, embrocation, Hp. Hum. 5.
one must anoint, Sor. 2.16, Gp. 16.6.1.
rubbed in as an ointment, Theoc. 11.2; εἰς τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς Arist. GA 747a9.

anoint, ἀλείμμασιν ἑαυτόν Duris 10 J., cf. AP 11.117 ( Strat.); τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς Apoc. 3.18: metaph., ψευδηγόροις φήμαις ἐγχρίειν ἔπη Lyc. 1455:— Med., anoint oneself, ἰξοῦ Str. 15.1.29; ἐ. τὸ πρόσωπον Nic.Dam. p.2 D.: abs., Arr. Epict. 2.21.20, etc.:— Pass., Ph. 1.526.

children.label: II
children.definition: sting, prick, τινί Pl. Phdr. 251d:— Pass., ἰὸς ἐγχρισθείς poison injected by a sting, Ael. NA 1.54.
stick in, τὸ κέντρον ib. 6.20.
chronic character, νούσου dub. in Hp. Praec. 14.

to be long about a thing, delay, Th. 3.27; περὶ ὑποχόνδριον Hp. Acut. 50; ἐγχρονίσας after long delay, Epigr.Gr. 815.7; ἐ. πρὸς τὸν γάμον Arist. Rh. 1411a19; εἰς καιρόν Phld. Lib. p.13 O.; τινί in a thing, Plb. 15.36.6; ἐν τόπῳ D.C. 44.46:— Pass., Pl. Ep. 362a.

children.label: II
children.definition: become chronic, ἐγχρονίζει τὰ ἐμπυήματα Hp. Prog. 17; ἐγχρονίζον ἔθος Ph. 2.203; continue in, τῷ καταστήματι Procl. Par.Ptol. 51:— Pass., ἐγχρονισθὲν τὸ νόσημα Pl. Grg. 480b, cf. Arist. HA 586a18.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., c. acc. pers., waste a personʼs time, Vett.Val. 150.10.
temporal, φύσεις Procl. in Prm. p.638 S.
prolonged use, Sor. 1.46, Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.23.10.
lasting a short time, App. Fr. 3 (expld. by Suid. as recent).
in time, temporal, opp. αἰώνιος, Ocell. 1.2, Ascl. in Metaph. 424.7, Procl. Inst. 53, al., Dam. Pr. 90, al., Simp. in Ph. 461.12.
golden, ὅπλον Schwyzer 647.35 ( Cyme, i A.D.); στολή Philostr. Im. 1.22; πρόσοψις D.S. 3.39.
gild, Tz. H. 3.975 ( Pass.).

to be engrained, ἐν ἅπασι τοῖς μέρεσιν ἐγκέχρωσται ἡ λευκότης Arist. Xen. 978a11: metaph., to be amalgamated with, πάθος ἐγκεχρωσμένον τῷ βίῳ Id. EN 1105a3; νόμον ἐν τοῖς ἤθεσι καὶ τοῖς ἐπιταδεύμασι τῶν πολιτᾶν ἐγχρῴζεσθαι δεῖ Archyt. ap. Stob. 4.1.138:— Act. only ἐγχρώσας· χρίσας, Hsch.

data.quote: ἐν ἅπασι τοῖς μέρεσιν ἐγκέχρωσται ἡ λευκότης
νόμον ἐν τοῖς ἤθεσι καὶ τοῖς ἐπιταδεύμασι τῶν πολιτᾶν ἐγχρῴζεσθαι δεῖ

children.definition: Et.Gen. s.v. ἐν χρῷ.
parti-coloured, Sch. Ar. Pl. 530.
fish, Hsch.
convert into juice (by pressing), Thphr. CP 6.11.14.
to be converted into chyle, τὰ ἐγκεχυλωμένα Gal. 8.369.
juicy, succulent, Hp. Aff. 59, Thphr. CP 6.11.15 ( Comp.); ἰχθύς Agatharch. 40; savoury, Alex. 124.12; soft-boiled, of eggs, Gal. 6.707. Adv. - λως dub. in Archig. ap. Gal. 8.931.
Paul.Aeg. 2.11, Aret. CD 2.13.
instillation, Gal. 12.649.

children.label: II
children.definition: filling, content, of a vessel, Hp. Cord. 8, Gal. 11.260,7.524.

children.label: III
children.definition: Hsch.
make an infusion of, τι Dsc. 1.45 ( Pass.), Gp. 4.7.3, Aesop. 18.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐ. τινά treat by injections, Hippiatr. 129.

children.label: III
children.definition: instil, inject, Sor. 1.64, Archig. ap. Gal. 12.621, etc.
injection, instillation, Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.26.1, Sor. 1.56, Hippiatr. 68.
injections, Dsc. Eup. 1.55.
one must inject, Sor. 1.69, Orib. 46.25.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: one must make an infusion, Gp. 18.17.1.
moistened, ἔγχυμα χυμῷ Hp. Off. 11; juicy, succulent, σάρξ Pl. Ti. 74d, cf. Thphr. CP 5.4.3; sapid, Arist. Sens. 442b29.
stirring up, enlivening, in pl., Hp. Epid. 2.4.4.

definition: ἐγχύνω, late form of ἐγχέω, Luc. Pr.Im. 29, etc.

children.definition: pouring in, Plu. Aud. 2.38f, Hero Spir. 1.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: pouring of wine into casks, PPetr. 2p.136 (iii B.C.).
one must pour in, Gp. 6.7.4, al.
pour libations, τοῖς καμοῦσι Herod. 5.84.
poured in, infused, Aret. CD 2.3; ἔγχυτον, τό, injection, Hp. Mul. 1.34, Apollon. ap. Gal. 12.582.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἔγχυτος (sc. πλακοῦς), ὁ, cake cast into a shape, Hippon. 37, Men. 518.9, Euang. 1.7:—also ἐγχῠτοῦς, ὁ, Gloss.
ἔγχυτον, τό, = ἔγχυμα, infusion, Aret. CA 2.10.

definition: ἐγχύτριαι αἱ τὰς χόας τοῖς τετελευτηκόσιν ἐπιφέρουσαι, Sch.rec. Ar. V. 289.

children.definition: expose children in an earthenware vessel, Hsch.: hence, make away with, Ar. V. 289.
woman who gathered the bones from a funeral pile into an urn, Pl. Min. 315c (v.l. ἐγχυτίστρια), cf. EM 313.41.

children.label: II
children.definition: woman who exposed children, acc. to Sch. Ar. V. 289 (but cf. ἐγχύτριαι).
bar of a river, Plb. 4.39.9.
fill up by depositing earth, of rivers, Plb. 4.40.4 ( Pass.); ἐ. τάφρον App. BC 5.36.

children.label: II
children.definition: throw in earth, εἰς τάφρον ἐνεχώννυον ib. 2.75, cf. D.S. 17.42.

give room to do a thing, allow, ὁ χρόνος οὐκ ἐγχωρεῖ, c. inf., Lys. 26.6, X. Eq. 12.13: abs., ὅσον ἐνεχώρεε ἡ δεκάτη so far as the money allowed her to go, Hdt. 2.135; ἂν ἐγχωρῇ τὸ ὕδωρ (i.e. the water-clock), D. 44.45.

children.label: b
children.definition: admit of, κλίσιν Arr. Tact. 11.4.

ἐγχωρεῖ, impers., there is time, it is possible or allowable, c. dat. pers. et inf., ἐ. αὐτῷ εἰδέναι Antipho 1.7, cf. 5.90, Pl. Prt. 321d, X. HG 2.3.16, etc.; οἷς ἐ. ὑβρισταῖς εἶναι Lys. 24.15: also abs., ἔτι ἐ. there is yet time, Pl. Phd. 116e; οὐκέτʼ ἐγχωρεῖ D. 4.41; = ἐνδέχεται, Arist. APr. 25b10, al.; ἐφʼ ὁπόσον ἂν ἐγχωρῇ D.H. Comp. 6; ἐγχωροῦν ἐστί Paus. 3.24.11; κατὰ τὸ ἐγχωροῦν as far as possible, Paul.Aeg. 6.99.

children.label: II
children.definition: pass, εἰς ἑτέραν ὑποθήκην BGU 907.15 (iii A. D.).

definition: ἐγχώριος, ον, also η or α, ον Hdt. 6.35, Pi. O. 5.11: ( χώρα):—

children.definition: in or of the country, ἐσθὴς ἐγχωρίη Hdt. l.c.; ἐγχωρία λίμνα Pi. l.c.; βασιλῆες ib. 9.56; ἐ. θεοί A. Th. 14, S. Tr. 183, Sammelb. 5680 (iii B. C.); θεοὶ καὶ ἥρωες Th. 2.74; Ἑλληνικοῖς καὶ ἐ. γράμμασι OGI 194.30 (i B. C.); κάρτα δʼ ἔστʼ ἐ. a true-born Theban, A. Th. 413; ἐ. [πυροί], opp. ἐπείσακτοι, Arist. Mir. 836b22; of winds, local, Thphr. CP 5.12.11.
Subst., dweller in the land, ἐ. τῆσδε γῆς inhabitants, S. OC 871, cf. E. Ion 1167; οἱ ἐ. Arist. PA 673a18, Wilcken Chr. 1.2 (iii B. C.), etc.
τὸ ἐ. as Adv., according to the custom of the country, Th. 4.78. Adv. - ίως Sch. E. Ph. 134.

children.label: II
children.definition: of or for the country, rustic, Hes. Op. 344 (v.l. ἐγκώμιον).

children.label: III
children.definition: ἐγχώριον· τόκος, δάνειον, Hsch.
= foreg., S. Ph. 692 (lyr.), OC 125 (lyr.), Lyc. 509, etc.; φάσματα S. Ichn. 322 (lyr.).
silting up of a channel, Arist. Mete. 352b34, Plb. 4.39.10, etc.: pl., Str. 5.3.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: bank, dyke, αἱ ἐ. τῶν τάφρων Ph. Bel. 100.24, cf. Ostr.Strassb. 777.
useful for filling up, ὄργανα App. BC 5.36.

definition: ἐγώ, I: Pron. of the first person:— Ep. mostly ἐγών before vowels (so in Dor., before consonants, Epich. 85, Sophr. 81, Ar. Ach. 748, 754), rarely in Trag., A. Pers. 932 (lyr.); Boeot. ἱών A.D. Pron. 51.4:— strengthd. ἔγωγε,

children.definition: I at least, for my part, indeed, for myself (more freq. in Att. than in Hom.): Dor. ἐγώνγα Alcm. 51, Ar. Ach. 736, Lys. 986, dat. ἐμίνγα IG 2(2).1126.7 (Amphict. Delph.): Boeot. ἱώνγα Corinn. 21; ἱώνει Ead. 10; ἰώγα Ar. Ach. 898: Lacon. and Tarent. ἐγώνη, Hsch., A.D. Conj. 255.29.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐμοῦ, enclit. μου; Ion. and Ep. ἐμέο, ἐμεῦ, μευ, also ἐμέθεν Il. 1.525, E. Hel. 177 (lyr.); Aeol. ἔμεθεν Sapph. 94.7 L.-P.; ἐμεῖο IG 3.1337; μεθέν Sophr. 20; Dor. ἐμέος, ἐμεῦς, Epich. 144; Boeot. ἐμοῦς Corinn. 37; also ἐμῶς, ἐμίο, ἐμίω, ἐμίως A.D. Pron. 74.17:—dat. ἐμοί, enclit. μοι (which may be compared with Skt. gen. me in κλῦθί μοι Il. 5.115, al.); ὅ μοι πόσις Schwyzer 683 (Cypr.); Dor. ἐμίν Epich. 99, AJA 29.461 ( Rhodian, v B. C.), Ar. Ach. 733, Theoc. 4.30; Tarent. ἐμίνη Rhinth. 13: acc. ἐμέ, enclit. με; Cypr. μι Inscr.Cypr. 59,60 H.

children.label: III
children.definition: νῶι, we two, Il. 5.34, etc.; acc. νῶιν Zenod.ad Il. 8.377; Att. νώ Pl. Phdr. 278b (also Il. 5.219, Od. 15.475); νῶε Antim. 39, Corinn. 5: gen., dat. νῶιν; νῷν S. Ant. 3; νῶι dat., Orph. L. 773; νῶιν, = ἡμῖν, Q.S. 1.213, etc.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἡμεῖς ( ἡμέες f.l. in Hdt. 2.6, al., rejected by A.D. Pron. 93.1); Aeol. ἄμμες Od. 9.303, Alc. 18.3, Pi. P. 4.144; Dor. ἁμές Alcm. 65, Epich. 42, Ar. Lys. 168:—gen. ἡμῶν (also ἥμων A.D. Synt. 130.23); Ion. ἡμέων Hdt. 1.112, etc.; ἡμείων Od. 24.170, Herod. 1.46; Aeol. ἀμμέων Alc. 88, Milet. 3 No.152.29; ἄμμων ib. 74, A.D. Pron. 95.3; Dor. ἁμέων Alcm. 66; ἁμῶν [ Epich.] 266, Ar. Lys. 168, Theoc. 2.158; Cret., Boeot. ἁμίων SIG 528.5, A.D. Pron. 95.21:—dat. ἡμῖν, in S. also ἡμίν ( ῐ) (or ἧμιν Aristarch.ad Il. 1.214, A.D. Pron. 95.3); also rarely in Com., Phryn.Com. 37, Ar. Av. 386 (dub.); Aeol. ἄμμῐν, ἄμμῐ, Il. 1.384, Alc. 80, al., Pi. P. 4.155, A. Th. 156 (lyr.), Milet. 3 No.152; ἄμμεσιν Alc. 100; Dor. also ἁμίν or ἇμιν, Alcm. 77, 78, A. Eu. 347 (lyr.), Ar. Lys. 1081; with ῑ, Id. Ach. 821, Theoc. 7.145:—acc. ἡμᾶς (also ἧμᾰς Od. 16.372); Ion. ἡμέας Il. 8.211, SIG 273.25 ( Milet., iv B. C.); ἥμεας Od. 4.294 (cf. Hdn.Gr. 2.140); Aeol. ἄμμε Il. 1.59, Sapph. 115, Theocr.8.25; Dor. ἁμέ SIG 1 ( Abu Simbel, vi B. C.), Epich. 173, Ar. Ach. 759 codd., Lys. 95.—On these dialectic varieties, v. A.D. Pron. 50 sqq. (Cf. Skt. ahám ( ἐγών), acc. pl. asmá̄n; for νώ cf. Skt. nau):—freq. in answers, as an affirmative, esp. in form ἔγωγε, S. Tr. 1248, Pl. Tht. 149b, etc.; οὗτος ἐ. here am I, Pi. O. 4.26; ὅδʼ ἐκεῖνος ἐ. S. OC 138 (lyr.); rarely with Art., τὸν ἐμέ myself, Pl. Tht. 166a, Sph. 239b (but ὁ ἐ. the Self, the Ego, Dam. Pr. 444); τίς ὢν οὗτος ὁ ἐγὼ τυγχάνω; Plu. Col. 2.1119a; τί ἐστι φίλος; ἄλλος ἐ. Pythag. ap. Herm. in Phdr. p.166 A.; τί τοῦτʼ ἐμοί; ἡμῖν τί τοῦτʼ ἔστʼ; Lat. quid mea hoc refert ? Ar. Th. 498, etc.; ἐγώ; in a question, Ar. Eq. 1336, al.; ἡμεῖς the self, ἔνθα δὴ ἡμεῖς μάλιστα Plot. 1.1.7.
Hsch., Suid.

definition: ἐγᾦδα, ἐγᾦμαι, Att. crasis for ἐγὼ οἶδα, ἐγὼ οἶμαι. ἐγών, ἐγώνγα, ἐγώνη, dialectic forms of ἐγώ, ἔγωγε (q. v.). ἐδααία· ἐρημία, Hsch.
ἐδάην, ης, η, aor. 2 of *δάω. ἐδαλάχθη· ἐδήχθη, Hsch. ἐδάμην, ης, η, Ep. aor. 2 Pass. of δαμάω. ἐδάνη· εἶδος ἀμπέλου, Id.

children.definition: eatable: ἐδανόν, τό, food, A. Ag. 1407.

definition: ἑδανός, ή, όν, as epith. of oil, Il. 14.172, cj. in h.Ven. 63; expld. by Gramm. as cogn. with ἡδύς, ἥδομαι, ἁνδάνω (q. v.),

children.definition: sweet, cf. Hdn.Gr. 2.89, Apollon. Lex. s.v.

definition: ἔδαρ βρῶμα, Hsch. (i.e. ἔδϝαρ, cf. εἶδαρ).

children.definition: belonging to a floor, Tz. H. 3.211; gloss on γονυπετής, Sch. E. Ph. 293.
beat level and firm like a floor or pavement, Plb. 6.33.6, Thphr. HP 9.3.1:— Pass., Id. CP 4.8.2, Arist. Pr. 934b10.

children.label: II
children.definition: provide with a floor, οἶκον IG ΙΙ(2).158 A 66 (iii B. C.), cf. BCH 29.475.

children.label: III
children.definition: dash to the ground, LXX Ps. 136(137).9, Ev.Luc. 19.44.
pertaining to land, ἔργα PLond. 2.163.19 (i A.D.); ἐλάσσωμα BGU 20.8 (ii A.D.).
Dim. of >ἔδαφος 4, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 738.17; τῶν κατηγοριῶν τὰ ἐ. Dexipp. in Cat. 5.14, cf. Eust. 1532.63, Tz. H. 4.202, Sch. Pi. O. 5.1.
Hsch. s.h.v.
raze to the ground, J. Vit. 19.

bottom, foundation, base of anything, τῆς κατασκευῆς τὰ ἐ. Th. 1.10; ἔ. νηός bottom of a ship, Od. 5.249; ἔ. πλοίου D. 32.5, cf. Pherecr. 12; ἔ. ποταμοῦ, τῆς θαλάττης, X. Cyr. 7.5.18, Arist. HA 534a11; [ ποτηρίου] Pherecr. 143.2.

ground-floor, pavement, οἴκου Hdt. 8.137; καθελεῖν ἐς ἔ. raze to the ground, Th. 3.68; τὸ ἔ. ὁμαλίσασι IG ΙΙ(2).161 A 57 ( Delos, iii B.C.); ἔπεσον εἰς τὸ ἔ. Act.Ap. 22.7; ἀπὸ ἐδάφους μέχρι παντὸς ὕψους CPR 95.17 (iii A. D.), etc.

ground, soil, περὶ τοῦ τῆς πατρίδος ἐδάφους ἀγωνίζεσθαι for our countryʼs soil, Aeschin. 3.134, cf. D. 26.11 (pl.); ἐχθρὸς τῷ τῆς πόλεως ἐδάφει, of a mortal foe, Id. 8.39, 10.11; ὀκρυόειν ἔ. Eleg.Alex.Adesp. 1.7; soil, viewed in regard to its quality, Thphr. CP 2.4.1 (pl.), 4.11.8: pl., ἐδάφη lands and tenements (incl. houses), Is. 11.42, IG 2.780, PTeb. 302.10 (i A.D.); also, masses of earth, Epicur. Ep. 2p.48U.
text of a manuscript, opp. margin ( μέτωπον), Gal. 16.837, 18(2).864.

children.label: b
children.definition: manuscript, Id. 16.468 (s.v.l.).
background of puppet-theatre, Hero Aut. 30.1, al.
establish, Hsch.
one who tasted first, and named the order of dishes, = θαλίαρχος, seneschal, Phylarch. Fr. 44J., cf. EM 315.37, Suid.; steward, PCair.Zen. 31.18; cf. ἐλέατρος.

definition: ἐδέγμην, v. δέχομαι. ἐδεδέατο, v. δέω bind.
ἐδεδμήατο, v. δέμω. ἐδέζετο· ἐπολεμεῖτο, Hsch.
ἐδέθλιον, τό, = sq., Call. Ap. 62, A.R. 4.630, Nonn. D. 3.258, al.

children.definition: Antim. 28, Call. Ap. 73, Lyc. 987, A.R. 4.331; τὰ χρυσόπαστα δʼ ἔδεθλα should be read (with Auratus) in A. Ag. 776 for ἐσθλά.

children.label: II
children.definition: precinct, shrine, SIG 364.21 ( Ephesus, iii B. C.); τόδε νάσω ἔ. Epigr.Gr. 978.9 ( Philae).

definition: ἐδείδιμεν, ἐδείδῐσαν, v. δείδω. ἔδεκτο, v. δέχομαι.
ἐδελώνη ἄνθος, Hsch. ἕδεος· Θεσσαλικὸς θρόνος, Id.

children.definition: meat, food, Pl. Ti. 73a, Antiph. 26.10: pl., eatables, meats, Batr. 31, X. Hier. 1.23, Pl. R. 559b, Antiph. 82.1, Porph. Abst. 1.55: metaph., οὐ γὰρ ἡδύσματι χρῆται ἀλλʼ ὡς ἐδέσματι τοῖς ἐπιθέτοις Arist. Rh. 1406a19:— Dim. ἐδεσμάτιον, τό, Procl.ad Hes. Op. 41.

data.quote: οὐ γὰρ ἡδύσματι χρῆται ἀλλʼ ὡς ἐδέσματι τοῖς ἐπιθέτοις

children.definition: food-hamper, Sch. Od. 6.76.
one must eat, Pl. Cri. 47b, Prt. 314a.
eater, Hdt. 3.99, Antiph. 26.15.
eatable, good for food, ζῷον Arist. Pol. 1324b41; ἐδεστά eatables, meats, E. Fr. 472.19, Pl. Ti. 72e: sg., Call. Fr. 128.

children.label: II
children.definition: eaten, S. Ant. 206; consumed, ἐξ αὑτοῦ Id. Tr. 677.

definition: ἐδήδοκα, ἐδήδεσμαι, ἐδήδοται, ἐδηδώς, v. ἔδω, ἐσθίω.

children.definition: Hsch.
meat, food, in Hom. always in phrase, πόσιος καὶ ἐδητύος ἐξ ἔρον ἕντο Il. 1.469, etc.; exc. Od. 6.250 δηρὸν γὰρ ἐδητύος ἦεν ἄπαστος.

data.quote: πόσιος καὶ ἐδητύος ἐξ ἔρον ἕντο

definition: ἑδνάς ἡ ἀπὸ τῶν ἕδνων ἐδητύς, Hsch.

children.definition: bridal, χιτών Hsch.

definition: ἕδνον, τό, Pi. O. 9.10, Call. Fr. 193, Theoc. 25.114, 27.33, Orph. A. 873, Nonn. D. 42.28, al.; elsewh. only pl. ἕδνα, ἔεδνα:—

children.definition: bride-price or wedding-gifts ( φερνή being the brideʼs portion), ὄπυιε πορὼν ἀπερείσια ἕ. Il. 16.178; ἠγάγετο . . ἐπεὶ πόρε μυρία ἕ. ib. 190, cf. 22.472; μνάσθω ἐέδνοισιν διζήμενος Od. 16.391; εἰς ὅ κέ μοι . . πατὴρ ἀποδῷσιν ἔεδνα 8.318; rare in Trag., ἕδνοις ἄγαγες Ἡσιόναν πιθὼν δάμαρτα A. Pr. 559 (lyr.): later Prose, Parth. 20.1.

data.quote: εἰς ὅ κέ μοι . . πατὴρ ἀποδῷσιν ἔεδνα

children.label: II
children.definition: wedding-gifts made to the bride by those of her own household, Od. 1.277, 2.196, E. Andr. 2, Pi. O. 9.10; but,

children.label: III
children.definition: Id. P. 3.94, Orph. l.c., D.C. 79.12, wedding-presents to a wedded pair by their guests.

children.label: IV
children.definition: gift, Theoc. 25.114.
bring wedding-presents, Eust. 1414.49.

promise for wedding-presents, betroth, ἡμῖν ἕδνωσε θύγατρας Theoc. 22.147:— Med. in Hom., of a father, ὥς κʼ αὐτὸς ἐεδνώσαιτο θύγατρα Od. 2.53; ἑδνώσομαί τε θυγατέρʼ ( Herm. for ἐδώσομαι) E. Hel. 933.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., of a husband, dower a wife, Hes. Fr. 94.47; simply, marry, γυναῖκα AP 7.648 ( Leon.); woo, Nonn. D. 6.3.
bride betrothed for ἕδνα, Hsch.
father who portions a bride, οὔ τοι ἐεδνωταὶ κακοί εἰμεν Il. 13.382.

definition: ἔδομαι, fut. of ἐσθίω, ἔδω. ἔδον, Ep. and Dor. 3 pl. aor. 2 of δίδωμι.

children.label: II
children.definition: impf. of ἔδω.

definition: ἑδοξοεῖ ἀγαλματοποιεῖ, Hsch. ἐδοργύπευσεν· ἔσφαξεν ἢ ἐπέρανεν, Id.
ἕδος, εος, τό, Ep. dat. pl. ἑδέεσσιν IG 14.1389 ii 19:—

children.definition: sitting-place:
seat, stool, Il. 1.534 (pl.), 581 (pl.), 9.194, etc.; ἕ. Θεσσαλικόν straight-backed chair, Hp. Art. 7.

seat, abode, dwelling-place, esp. of the gods, ἐς Ὄλυμπον . . ἵνʼ ἀθανάτων ἕ. ἐστί Il. 5.360; ἵκοντο θεῶν ἕ. αἰπὺν Ὄλυμπον ib. 367, cf. Theoc. 7.116; periphr., ἕ. Οὐλύμποιο, = Ὄλυμπος, Il. 24.144, cf. Pi. O. 2.12; of the abodes of men, Θήβης ἕ. Il. 4.406; Ἰθάκης ἕ. Od. 13.344; ἕ. Μάκαρος the abode of Macar, Il. 24.544: periphr., Τροίας ἕ. B. 8.46; ἔποικον ἕ., = ἐποικίαι, A. Pr. 412.

data.quote: ἐς Ὄλυμπον . . ἵνʼ ἀθανάτων ἕ. ἐστί

children.definition: seated statue of a god, S. OT 886 (lyr.), El. 1374, IG 2.754, al., Isoc. 15.2, X. HG 1.4.12, Porph. Abst. 2.18, Polem.Hist. 90, Plu. Per. 13, Paus. 8.46.2; τὰ ἕ. τῶν θεῶν, i.e. the Lat. Penates, D.H. 1.47; also of a man worshipped as a hero, IG 14.2133; τὰ τῶν θεῶν ἕδη καὶ τοὺς νεώς Isoc. 4.155; τοὺς νεὼς καὶ τὰ ἕδη καὶ τὰ τεμένη Lycurg. 143; θεῶν ἕδη (v.l. ἄλση) καὶ ἱερά Pl. Phd. 111b, cf. Tim. Lex. ἕδος· τὸ ἄγαλμα, καὶ ὁ τόπος ἐν ᾧἵδρυται, but this latter use is doubtful in early Prose; later, temple, Ph. 2.314; ἕ. ὑπαίθριον D.C. 51.1.

data.quote: τὰ τῶν θεῶν ἕδη καὶ τοὺς νεώς
τοὺς νεὼς καὶ τὰ ἕδη καὶ τὰ τεμένη

children.definition: foundation, base, Hes. Th. 117, Epigr. ap. Vitr. 8.3.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: act of sitting, οὐχ ἕδος ἐστί ʼtis no time to sit idle, Il. 11.648, 23.205; cf. ἕδρα II. (Cf. Skt. sádas ‘seat’.)

definition: ἕδρα, Ep. and Ion. ἕδρη, ἡ: ( ἕδος):

children.label: I
children.definition: sitting-place:

seat, chair, stool, bench, Il. 19.77, Od. 3.7; ἀγοραί τε καὶ ἕδραι 8.16, cf. 3.31; seat of honour, περὶ μέν σε τίον . . ἕδρῃ τε κρέασίν τε Il. 8.162, 12.311; ἕδραις γεραίρειν τινά X. Cyr. 8.1.39; τιμίαν ἕ. ἔχειν A. Eu. 855; throne, ἐκβαλεῖν ἕδρας Κρόνον Id. Pr. 203; θακεῖν παγκρατεῖς ἕ. to sit on an almighty throne, ib. 391, cf. Pers. 466.

data.quote: περὶ μέν σε τίον . . ἕδρῃ τε κρέασίν τε

children.definition: seat, abode, freq. in pl., Pi. O. 7.76, P. 11.63, etc.; esp. of the gods, sanctuary, temple, Id. I. 7(6).44, A. Ag. 596, etc.; also νέοικος ἕ. station for ships, Pi. O. 5.8; ναύλοχοι ἕδραι S. Aj. 460: periphr., ἕδραισι Θεράπνας Pi. P. 11.63; Παρνησοῦ ἕδραι A. Eu. 11, cf. E. Tr. 557 (lyr.); βλεφάρων ἕ. the eye, Id. Rh. 8 (anap.); ὄμματος ἕ. ib. 554 (lyr.).

seat or place of anything, ἐξ ἕδρας out of its right place, Id. Ba. 928, cf. Plu. Fab. 3; καταναγκάσαι ἐς ἕδρην Hp. Mochl. 38; ὁ ἥλιος ἐκλιπὼν τὴν ἕ. Hdt. 7.37; τὴν τοῦ ἥπατος ἕ., σπλάγχνου, etc., Pl. Ti. 67b, 72c, etc.; ἐκ τῆς ἕ. ὠθεῖν ib. 79b; ἔχειν ἕδραν to keep its place, Arist. Mete. 356a4; μεταθέσεις ἐξ ἕδρας ἀτόμων Epicur. Fr. 61; ἕδραν στρέφειν to wriggle, Thphr. Char. 27.14; στοὰν εἰς τὴν ἀρχαίαν ἕ. ἐπαναγαγεῖν D.C. 57.21; base, Plu. Demetr. 21: metaph. in Rhet., D.H. Dem. 31, etc.; of a plant, Gp. 5.9.9.

data.quote: στοὰν εἰς τὴν ἀρχαίαν ἕ. ἐπαναγαγεῖν

children.definition: ἡ ἕ. τοῦ ἵππου the back of the horse, on which the rider sits, X. Eq. 5.5, 12.9, Eq. Mag. 4.1.
quarters of the sky in which omens appear, A. Ag. 118 (lyr.), E. HF 596.
seat of a physiological process, ἕ. ἀναθρέψεως Gal. 18(2).105.

children.label: II
children.definition: sitting, esp. of suppliants, ἕδραν ἔχειν προστρόπαιον A. Eu. 41, cf. S. OT 13, OC 112.

sitting still, Hp. Aër. 20: hence, inactivity, delay, περιημέκτεε τῇ ἕδρῃ Hdt. 9.41; ἀχθομένων τῇ ἕ. Th. 5.7; οὐχ ἕδρας ἀκμή S. Aj. 811; οὐχ ἕδρας ἀγών E. Or. 1291; οὐχ ἕδρας ἔργον B. Fr. 11; also οἰκίης ἕδρῃ sitting at home, Herod. 4.92.
position, γονυπετεῖς ἕδραι kneeling, E. Ph. 293 (lyr.); βέλεος ἕδρη place occupied by a weapon which fixes itself in the skull, Hp. VC 7.

sitting, session of a council, etc., εὐθὺς ἐξ ἕδρας when he rose from the sitting, S. Aj. 780 (but ἐξ ἕδρας ἀνίσταται ib. 788, means from quietude); ἕδραν ποιεῖν to hold a sitting, And. 1.111, cf. IG 1(2).110.41.

children.label: III
children.definition: seat, breech, fundament, Hdt. 2.87, Hp. Aph. 5.22, Ar. Th. 133, etc.; of birds and animals, rump, Arist. HA 633b8, Simon Eq. 9, etc.

children.label: IV
children.definition: face of a regular solid, Theol.Ar. 37.

cause to sit, place, ἐπὶ πλευρᾶς D.H. Comp. 6; ἄλλυδις AP 15.24 ( Simm.); settle, establish, Jul. Or. 5.165a, Procl. Inst. 64, Simp. in Ph. 528.21, Sch. A.R. 4.947:— Med. or Pass., to be seated or fixed, Callix. 1, Haussoullier Milet p.163, Porph. Marc. 19, Dam. Pr. 138; ἡδρασμένος secure, θρόνος D.Chr. 1.78, cf. Sor. 2.22.

definition: ἔδραθον, ες, ε, poet. aor. 2 of δαρθάνω.
ἑδραῖος, α, ον, also ος, ον Pl. R. 407b, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.288d:—

children.definition: sitting, sedentary, of persons or their occupations, ἔργον Hp. Art. 53; οἱ πολλοὶ τῶν τὰς τέχνας ἐχόντων ἑδραῖοί εἰσι X. Lac. 1.3; ἑ. ἀρχαί, opp. στρατεῖαι, Pl. R. 407b; ἑ. βίος AP 11.42 ( Crin.).

data.quote: οἱ πολλοὶ τῶν τὰς τέχνας ἐχόντων ἑδραῖοί εἰσι

children.definition: ἑδραία ῥάχις the horseʼs back on which the rider sits, E. Rh. 783.

children.label: II
children.definition: steady, steadfast, κάθησʼ ἑδραία Id. Andr. 266; δεῖ τὴν γυναῖκα ὥσπερ κύβον ἑδραῖον εἶναι Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.288d, cf.952d; κύβος -ότατον σῶμα Ti.Locr. 98c; ἑ. βάσεις Pl. Ti. 59d; ἑδραιότατον στοιχεῖον εἶναι τὴν γῆν Heraclit. All. 41; ὂν τὸ πάντων -ότατον Plot. 6.2.8; ἑ. ὕπνος sound sleep, Hp. Epid. 6.4.15; of a cup, Ath. 11.496a: metaph. in Rhet., firmly based, κατάληξις Demetr. Eloc. 19, cf. Longin. 40.4. Adv. - αίως firmly, Ath.Mech. 36.10, Hdn. 3.14.5; steadily, Procl. Hyp. 3.21.

data.quote: δεῖ τὴν γυναῖκα ὥσπερ κύβον ἑδραῖον εἶναι

stability, Corn. ND 14, Procl. in Prm. p.794 S., in Ti. 2.49D.

make stable, Hdn.Gr. 1.453:— Pass., become or be stable, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 16.
stay, support, τῆς ἀληθείας 1 Ep.Ti. 3.15.
establishing, Tz. Il. 120.11.

definition: ἕδρανον, τό, poet. form of ἕδρα,

OC 176, 233, Pae.Delph. 5, Maiist. 36; ἀλλʼ ἄνα ἐξ ἑδράνων rise from thy rest or idleness, S. Aj. 192; Trag. only in lyr. exc. Id. Fr. 1128.7 γῆ ἑδράνων ἔρημος, which is Stoic.
chair, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: stay, support, said of an anchor, in sg., AP 6.28 ( Jul.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pythag. name for eight, Theol.Ar. 55.
placing in position, πίθων Gp. 6.2 tit.
one must place, Gp. 6.2.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἑδράζομαι) one must sit, Sch. Il. 23.205.
establishing, making stable, δυνάμεις Procl. in Ti. 3.138 D., cf. Dam. Pr. 138; τοῦ δημιουργοῦ ἀγαθότης Simp. in Ph. 1355.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: Orib. Eup. 4.12.
Hsch. ἔδρησα, Ion. aor. 1 of δράω.
blowing steadily, of wind, Hsch.
seat or set:— Pass., sit, only in Ep. forms ἑδριόωνται Hes. Th. 388; ἑδριόωντο Il. 10.198, Od. 7.98; ἑδριάασθαι 3.35.
belonging to the anus, Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.58.7, Crito ap. Gal. 13.306, Aët. 14.3, etc.

Dim. of ἕδρα I.3, Id. s.v. ἑδώλια.

instrument for widening the passage of the anus, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.23.66, Leonidas ap. Paul.Aeg. 6.78, Gal. 19.110.
wrestler who throws his adversary, Argive fashion, by a cross-buttock, Theoc. 24.111.

definition: ἔδω, old Ep. pres. (also Hp. VM 4 (v.l.), Theoc. 5.128), for which in Att. ἐσθίω is used, Ep. inf. ἔδμεναι, ἐέδμεναι Emp. 128.10 (s.v.l.): impf. ἔδον, Ion. 3 sg. ἔδεσκε Il. 22.501: fut. ἔδομαι 18.271, Od. 9.369, Theoc. 3.53: pf. part. ἐδηδώς Il. 17.542, h.Merc. 560:— Pass., pf. ἐδήδοται Od. 22.56: aor. 1 subj. ἐδεσθῇ dub. l. in Hp. Vict. 2.54:—for the Att. forms, v. sub ἐσθίω; cf. also ἔσθω:—

data.quote: κύτισόν τε καὶ αἴγιλον αἶγες ἔδοντι

ἔησθα, Ep. 2 sg. impf. of εἰμί ( sum). ἔῃσι, Ep. 3 sg. subj. pres. of εἰμί ( sum).

definition: ἐθέλω or θέλω (v. infr.), Ep. subj. ἐθέλωμι Il. 1.549, 9.397: impf. ἤθελον 14.120, etc.; Ep. and Lyr. ἔθελον 6.336, Thgn. 606, B. 10.73; Ion. ἐθέλεσκον Il. 13.106, Hdt. 6.12: fut. ἐθελήσω Il. 18.262, etc.; θελήσω Antipho 5.99: aor. 1 ἠθέλησα Hdt. 2.2, etc.; Ep. ἐθέλησα Il. 18.396; imper. θέλησον A. Pr. 783; subj. θελήσῃ ib. 1028, X. Cyr. 2.4.19, etc.; opt. θελήσαιμι S. OC 1133; part. θελήσας Id. OT 649 (lyr.): pf. ἠθέληκα X. Cyr. 5.2.9, Aeschin. 2.139, D. 47.5; τεθέληκα (Alexandrian acc. to Phryn. 307) LXX Ps. 40(41).12, Phld. Rh. 2.76 S., S.E. M. 2.37: plpf. ἠθελήκει X. HG 6.5.21; ἐτεθελήκεσαν D.C. 44.26 codd. (elsewh. ἠθελήκεσαν as 46.47):— θέλω is never found in Hom. or Hes. exc. Il. 1.277 (dub.), ὅττι θέλοιεν Od. 15.317 as v.l. ( ἅσσʼ ἐθέλοιεν Aristarch.), nor in Aeol.; rarely in early Ep. and Eleg., θέλοι h.Ap. 46, θέλει Sol. 27.12; but is found in Ion. Inscrr., SIG 45.16 ( Halic., v B.C.), 1037.7 ( Milet., iv B.C.), and in Semon. 7.13, Hippon. 22 B, Anacr. 92:— both forms in codd. of Hdt. and Hp. and in Heraclit. and Democr., also in Pi. and B.: Trag. never use ἐθέλω exc. in augmented forms, ἤθελον, -ησα: Com.never use θέλω exc. in phrases such as ἢν θεὸς θέλῃ, εἰ θεὸς θέλοι, Ar. Pl. 347, Ra. 533, or parodies of Trag.: early Att. Inscrr, have ἐθέλω IG 1(2).6.41, etc., till 250 B.C., when θέλω becomes common: Att. Prose writers rarely use θέλω exc. in phrases such as ἂν θεὸς θέλῃ Din. 2.3 or after a long vowel, e.g. μὴ θελῆσαι Th. 5.72, μὴ θελήσας Is. 8.11, μὴ θέλοντας And. 1.22, τῷ θέλοντι Id. 4.7, etc.; but θέλω Antipho 3.4.3, θελήσουσιν Id. 5.99: in later Gr. θέλω is regular exc. in the augmented forms; ἐθέλω is not found in LXX or NT:—

children.definition: to be willing (of consent rather than desire, v. βούλομαι I), but also generally, wish, Od. 3.324:—Constr.: abs., esp. in part., ἐθέλων ἐθέλουσαν ἀνήγαγεν ib. 272; εἰ σύ γε σῷ θυμῷ ἐθέλοις Il. 23.894; ἀλλά μοι ἤθελε θυμός Od. 11.566: freq. folld. by inf. pres. or aor., wish to . . , Il. 7.364, etc.: with inf. supplied, εἰ δʼ ἐθέλεις πεζός (sc. ἰέναι) Od. 3.324: c. acc. et inf., wish that . . , Il. 19.274, Hdt. 1.3; rarely folld. by ὥστε, E. Hipp. 1327: later c. ἵνα, Ev.Matt. 7.12, etc.: not used c. acc. only, exc. when an inf. is easily supplied, εὔκηλος τὰ φράζεαι ἅσσʼ ἐθέλῃσθα (sc. φράζεσθαι) Il. 1.554, cf. 9.397, 7.182, Od. 14.172; σιτέονται δὲ οὐκ ὅσα ἐθέλουσι (sc. σιτέεσθαι) Hdt. 1.71, cf. Th. 5.50; εἰ καὶ τῆς ἀξίας ἔλαττον ἐθελήσειέ τις (sc. φράσαι) Jul. Or. 1.132a: also with neut. Pron. or Adj., τί δὴ θέλων; with what intent? A. Pr. 118.

data.quote: εἰ σύ γε σῷ θυμῷ ἐθέλοις

children.definition: μίμνειν οὐκ ἐθέλεσκον ἐναντίον they cared not to make a stand, i.e. they were un able, Il. 13.106; οὐδʼ . . ἤθελε θυμὸς τειρομένοις ἑτάροισιν ἀμυνέμεν 17.702: metaph. of things, of a stream, οὐδʼ ἔθελε προρέειν ἀλλʼ ἴσχετο would not run on, but stopped, 21.366, cf. Od. 8.223, 316, h.Cer. 45; αὔλειοι δʼ ἔτʼ ἔχειν οὐκ ἐθέλουσι θύραι Sol. 4.28; τὰ δένδρα οὐδέν μʼ ἐθέλει διδάσκειν Pl. Phdr. 230d, cf. R. 370b (said to be an Att. use, Greg.Cor. p.135 S.).

data.quote: οὐδʼ . . ἤθελε θυμὸς τειρομένοις ἑτάροισιν ἀμυνέμεν
τὰ δένδρα οὐδέν μʼ ἐθέλει διδάσκειν

children.definition: part., ἐθέλων or θέλων willingly, gladly, Od. 3.272, etc. (also πιθοῦ θελήσας S. OT 649 (lyr.)); οὐκ ἐθέλων, = ἀεκών, Il. 4.300; with Art. like ὁ βουλόμενος, whoever will, i.e. any one, S. Ph. 619, Aj. 1146, Pl. Grg. 508c, etc.
θέλεις οὐ θέλεις nolens volens, Arr. Epict. 3.9.16; θέλει οὐ θέλει 3.3.3ib. , M.Ant. 11.15.
μὴ ἔθελε, c. inf., do not, Il. 1.277, 2.247, E. Fr. 174.
εἰ θέλεις if you please, S. OT 343.
subj., τί σοι θέλεις δῆτʼ εἰκάθω; in what wilt thou that I give way to thee? ib. 651 (lyr.); θέλεις μείνωμεν αὐτοῦ; Id. El. 80.
maintain, hold, c. acc. et inf., Plu. 2.883e, Paus. 1.4.6.
delight in, love, ἔν τινι LXX 1 Ki. 18.22; τινά ib. Ps. 17(18).20; but οἱ κακῶς τινὰς θέλοντες their ill- wishers, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.234.
ordain, decree, ἠθέλησεν [ὁ ἡγεμὼν] τὸν κίνδυνον τῆς προβολῆς εἶναι πρός τινας CPR 20.17 (iii A.D.), etc.

data.quote: ἠθέλησεν [ὁ ἡγεμὼν] τὸν κίνδυνον τῆς προβολῆς εἶναι πρός τινας

children.definition: future event, like our will or shall, εἰ ἐθελήσει ἀναβῆναι ἡ τυραννίς Hdt. 1.109; εἰ ἐθελήσει ἐκτρέψαι τὸ ῥέεθρον ὁ Νεῖλος Id. 2.11; εἰ θέλει τοι μηδὲν ἀντίξοον καταστῆναι Id. 7.49, cf. Pl. R. 370b, etc.:—in this sense, very rarely of living things, οὐ δοῦναι θέλοι, = οὐκ ἂν δοίη, A. Eu. 429; εἴπερ . . οὗτός <σʼ> ἐθέλει κρατῆσαι Ar. V. 536, cf. Pi. N. 7.90, Pl. R. 375a.

data.quote: εἰ ἐθελήσει ἐκτρέψαι τὸ ῥέεθρον ὁ Νεῖλος
εἰ θέλει τοι μηδὲν ἀντίξοον καταστῆναι

children.definition: to be naturally disposed, to be wont or accustomed, c. inf., συμβάσιες ἰσχυραὶ οὐκ ἐ. συμμένειν Hdt. 1.74; μεγάλα πρήγματα μεγάλοισι κινδύνοισι ἐ. καταιρέεσθαι Id. 7.50; αἱ πλευραὶ οὐκ ἐθέλουσιν ἐς τὸ εὐρὺ αὔξεσθαι Hp. Art. 41; οὐκ ἐ. αἱ γνῶμαι . . ὁμοῖαι εἶναι Th. 2.89; τοῦτʼ ἐνδελεχὲς ἐ. γίγνεσθαι Arist. Mete. 347a5, cf. Metaph. 1013b27, al.; οὐ θέλει ζῆν, of premature births, Id. HA 575a28.

customary, ib. 1.433, al.
